sanskrit_text:
नारायणं नमस्कृत्य नरं चैव नरोत्तमम् ।
देवीं सरस्वतीं चैव ततो जयमुदीरयेत् ॥
transliteration: nārāyaṇaṃ namaskṛtya naraṃ caiva narottamam | devīṃ sarasvatīṃ caiva tato jayam udīrayet ||
translation_english: Having bowed to Lord Nārāyaṇa, to Nara the supreme among men, and to Goddess Sarasvatī, one should then utter the word of victory.

sanskrit_text:
मैत्रेय उवाच |
भगवन् ब्रह्मणः पुत्र कथयस्व महामुने |
पुराणं ब्रह्मसंबद्धं सर्वपापप्रणाशनम् ||
transliteration: maitreya uvāca | bhagavan brahmaṇaḥ putra kathayasva mahāmune | purāṇaṃ brahma-sambaddhaṃ sarva-pāpa-praṇāśanam ||
translation_english: Maitreya said: O venerable sage, son of Brahmā, please narrate the Purāṇa connected with Brahmā, which destroys all sins.

sanskrit_text:
सूत उवाच |
पुराणं ब्रह्मणः पुण्यं ब्रह्मलोकप्रदायकम् |
वक्ष्यामि विधिवद् विप्राः शृणुध्वं संशितव्रताः ||
transliteration: sūta uvāca | purāṇaṃ brahmaṇaḥ puṇyaṃ brahma-loka-pradāyakam | vakṣyāmi vidhivad viprāḥ śṛṇudhvam saṃśita-vratāḥ ||
translation_english: Sūta said: I shall properly narrate the sacred Brahma Purāṇa, which bestows the abode of Brahmā. Listen attentively, O disciplined sages.

sanskrit_text:
यत्र सर्गश्च प्रलयः कल्पानां च विनिश्चयः |
देवानां च ऋषीणां च राज्ञां च वंशवर्णनम् ||
transliteration: yatra sargaś ca pralayaḥ kalpānāṃ ca viniścayaḥ | devānāṃ ca ṛṣīṇāṃ ca rājñāṃ ca vaṃśa-varṇanam ||
translation_english: In which are described creation and dissolution, the divisions of cosmic ages, and the genealogies of gods, sages, and kings.

sanskrit_text:
धर्मार्थकाममोक्षाणां सम्यग् ज्ञानप्रदर्शनम् |
पुराणं ब्रह्मसंज्ञं तु श्रवणात् पापनाशनम् ||
transliteration: dharmārtha-kāma-mokṣāṇāṃ samyag jñāna-pradarśanam | purāṇaṃ brahma-saṃjñaṃ tu śravaṇāt pāpa-nāśanam ||
translation_english: This Brahma Purāṇa rightly expounds dharma, wealth, desire, and liberation, and merely hearing it destroys sins.

sanskrit_text: यं ध्यायन्ति बुधाः समाधिसमये शुद्धं वियत्सन्निभम् ।
transliteration: yaṃ dhyāyanti budhāḥ samādhisamaye śuddhaṃ viyatsannibham ||
translation_english: One who meditates upon that in the state of samādhi, pure and resembling spacious stillness, ...
…attains the eternal bliss, radiant and unblemished, the Lord of all, free from all qualities.

transliteration: yasmāt sarvam idaṃ prapañcaracitaṃ māyā jagajjāyate ||
translation_english: From which all this world, composed of the elements and the cosmic illusion, comes into being…

transliteration: yasmiṃstiṣṭhati yāti ca anta-samaye kalpānukalpe punaḥ ||
translation_english: …in which it abides and to which it returns at the end of the cosmic cycle and again at the start of the next.

sanskrit_text: यं ध्यात्वा मुनयः प्रपञ्चरहितं विन्दन्ति मोक्षं ध्रुवम् ।
transliteration: yaṃ dhyātvā munayaḥ prapañcaharitaṃ vindanti mokṣaṃ dhruvam ||
translation_english: Meditating upon that which is free from all manifestation, the sages attain unchanging liberation.
He is the supreme cause of creation, preservation, and dissolution, the sovereign Lord of the three worlds.

transliteration: avyaktam avyayaṃ śāntaṃ sūkṣmāt sūkṣmataraṃ harim ||
translation_english: He is unmanifest, imperishable, peaceful, subtler than the subtlest, and known as Hari.

sanskrit_text: न यस्य जन्म कर्म वा न नामरूपविकल्पनम् ।
transliteration: na yasya janma karma vā na nāma-rūpa-vikalpanam ||
translation_english: He has neither birth nor action, nor distinctions of name and form.

sanskrit_text: एक एव जगत्सर्वं व्याप्य तिष्ठति निर्गुणः ।
transliteration: eka eva jagat sarvaṃ vyāpya tiṣṭhati nirguṇaḥ ||
translation_english: He alone pervades the entire universe, existing beyond all qualities.

transliteration: tam eva śaraṇaṃ yānti jñātvā saṃsāra-bhīravaḥ ||
translation_english: Knowing Him, those fearful of worldly existence seek Him alone as refuge.
Freed from the knots of ignorance, they are illumined by the lamp of knowledge.
By His grace alone, the soul is released from bondage.

sanskrit_text: स ब्रह्मा स हरिः शक्रः स कालः स महेश्वरः ।
transliteration: sa brahmā sa hariḥ śakraḥ sa kālaḥ sa maheśvaraḥ ||
translation_english: He is Brahmā, He is Hari, He is Indra, He is Time, He is Mahēśvara.

transliteration: nānyad asti paraṃ tattvaṃ tasmāt sarvaṃ pratiṣṭhitam ||
translation_english: There is no higher reality than Him; upon Him everything rests.
Thus is declared the first chapter of the Brahma Purāṇa.

sanskrit_text: सर्गं प्रथितं ब्रह्मणैव यत् सृष्टेः कारणं परमम्।
transliteration: sargaṃ prathitaṃ brahmaṇaiva yat sṛṣṭeḥ kāraṇaṃ paramam ||
translation_english: The creation was first declared by Brahmā, who is the supreme cause of all existence.
All the worlds, organized and harmonious, are sustained through Him.
All is freed from the bonds of ignorance through self-knowledge.

sanskrit_text: शिवो हि प्रथमो देवः सृष्टेः संस्थापकः सदा।
transliteration: śivo hi prathamo devaḥ sṛṣṭeḥ sansthāpakaḥ sadā ||
translation_english: Shiva, the first deity, is always the establisher of creation.
Permeating all, the universe rests in the essence of Brahmā.
He is always the ultimate, fixed cause of all beings.

sanskrit_text: विद्यया यः जानाति स मोक्षमार्गे गच्छति।
transliteration: vidyayā yaḥ jānāti sa mokṣamārge gacchati ||
translation_english: He who knows Him through knowledge walks the path of liberation.
By action and knowledge of Brahmā, a person attains liberation.
Those who remember Brahmā follow the path of the virtuous.
Thus begins the second chapter of the Brahma Purāṇa.
In the beginning of creation, actions are guided and understood through the knowledge of Brahmā.

sanskrit_text: भूतानां च कारणं ब्रह्म तत्वे प्रतिष्ठितम्।
transliteration: bhūtānāṃ ca kāraṇaṃ brahma tattve pratiṣṭhitam ||
translation_english: Brahmā is established as the cause of all beings in essence.

sanskrit_text: जगत्सर्वं च व्याप्य ब्रह्मणि स्थितम् यथार्थतः।
transliteration: jagatsarvaṃ ca vyāpya brahmaṇi sthitam yathārthataḥ ||
translation_english: The entire universe pervades Brahmā and truly rests in Him.
Through knowledge in action, a human attains liberation, O Lord of Creatures.

sanskrit_text: सतां मार्गं गच्छन्ति ये ब्रह्मनिष्ठा पथे।
transliteration: satāṃ mārgaṃ gacchanti ye brahma-niṣṭhā pathe ||
translation_english: Those who are devoted to Brahmā follow the path of the virtuous.
Through ignorance, all beings are bound and suffer in worldly existence.
Only through knowledge does the path of liberation reveal itself, for the welfare of the world.

sanskrit_text: कर्मफलत्यागात् मुक्तः स्यात् ज्ञानेन च परां गतिम्।
transliteration: karmaphalatyāgāt muktaḥ syāt jñānena ca parāṃ gatim ||
translation_english: By renouncing the fruits of actions and through knowledge, one attains the supreme goal.
The qualities of goodness, passion, and ignorance, when transcended, lead one out of the ocean of worldly existence.
Thus ends the second chapter of the Brahma Purāṇa.
Through virtuous conduct and merits, a human attains purity.
Through yoga, one reaches the presence of Brahmā and proceeds on the path of liberation.
Truth and connection with Brahmā ensure the success of a practitioner’s spiritual efforts.
Controlled by ignorance, beings fall into suffering and bondage.
A person endowed with knowledge attains the world of Brahmā.

transliteration: satyena ca dharmeṇaiva jīvaḥ muktim āpnoti ||
translation_english: Through truthfulness and righteous conduct, the soul attains liberation.

sanskrit_text: व्रजति नित्यं धर्ममार्गे सिद्धिं लभते नरः।
transliteration: vrajati nityaṃ dharma-mārge siddhiṃ labhate naraḥ ||
translation_english: A person who constantly follows the path of righteousness achieves perfection.
By renouncing the desire for the fruits of action, the soul attains peace.
One should live always for the welfare of all beings through righteousness.
Through the yoga of Brahmā, a practitioner attains the path to liberation.
Through association with the virtuous and the path of knowledge, the soul is honored.
By the destruction of bodily attachments, liberation is always attained.

sanskrit_text: धर्मनिष्ठाः सदा जीवाः सुखी भवति लोके।
transliteration: dharmanishṭhāḥ sadā jīvāḥ sukhī bhavati loke ||
translation_english: Those steadfast in righteousness live happily in the world.
Through knowledge, practitioners attain the path of liberation.

sanskrit_text: सदा ब्रह्मनिष्ठः पुरुषः कर्त्तव्यं कर्म करोति।
transliteration: sadā brahma-niṣṭhaḥ puruṣaḥ karttavyaṃ karma karoti ||
translation_english: A person established in Brahmā always performs the duties prescribed.
By virtuous conduct, one is honored and attains perfection in Brahmā.
The path of liberation is revealed through renunciation of the fruits of action.
One transcending all qualities remains steadfast on the path of liberation.
A person endowed with knowledge attains the world of Brahmā.
Thus ends the second chapter of the Brahma Purāṇa.
A person should act for the welfare of all beings by following the path of righteousness.
By adhering to truth, the soul progresses on the path to liberation.
Renunciation of the fruits of all actions brings peace to the practitioner.
Those steadfast in righteousness remain firm on the path to liberation.
A person endowed with knowledge attains the world of Brahmā.
One who transcends all qualities remains always firm on the path of liberation.
Renunciation of attachment to the results of actions reveals the path to liberation.

sanskrit_text: सदा ब्रह्मनिष्ठः पुरुषः कर्त्तव्यं कर्म करोति।
transliteration: sadā brahma-niṣṭhaḥ puruṣaḥ karttavyaṃ karma karoti ||
translation_english: A person established in Brahmā always performs prescribed duties.
By virtuous conduct, one is honored and attains perfection in Brahmā.
Through association with the virtuous and the path of knowledge, the soul is honored.

sanskrit_text: धर्मनिष्ठाः सदा जीवाः सुखी भवति लोके।
transliteration: dharmanishṭhāḥ sadā jīvāḥ sukhī bhavati loke ||
translation_english: Those steadfast in righteousness live happily in the world.

transliteration: satyena ca dharmeṇaiva jīvaḥ muktim āpnoti ||
translation_english: Through truth and righteousness, the soul attains liberation.
Through yoga, one reaches the presence of Brahmā and proceeds on the path of liberation.
Through virtuous conduct and merits, a human attains purity.
Truth and connection with Brahmā ensure the success of a practitioner’s spiritual efforts.

A person endowed with knowledge attains the world of Brahmā.

transliteration: satyena ca dharmeṇaiva jīvaḥ muktim āpnoti ||
translation_english: Through truthfulness and righteous conduct, the soul attains liberation.
One established in Brahmā remains steadfast on the path of action.
Thus ends the third chapter of the Brahma Purāṇa.
A person should always strive to live by the path of righteousness.
By truthfulness alone, the soul becomes steadfast on the path of liberation.
Through virtuous conduct and merit, a person attains purity.
Through yoga, one attains the presence of Brahmā and follows the path of liberation.

transliteration: satyaena ca dharmeṇa jīvaḥ muktim āpnoti ||
translation_english: By truth and righteousness, the soul attains liberation.
One established in Brahmā remains steadfast on the path of action.
Truth and connection with Brahmā ensure the success of a practitioner’s spiritual efforts.
A person endowed with knowledge attains the world of Brahmā.
Through virtuous association and the path of knowledge, the soul is honored.
Those steadfast in righteousness live happily in the world.

transliteration: satyena ca dharmeṇaiva jīvaḥ muktim āpnoti ||
translation_english: Through truth and righteous conduct, the soul attains liberation.
By virtuous deeds and merit, a person attains purity.
Controlled by ignorance, beings fall into suffering.
Through yoga, one reaches the presence of Brahmā and follows the path of liberation.
Truth and connection with Brahmā ensure success in spiritual practice.
One established in Brahmā remains steadfast on the path of action.
A person endowed with knowledge attains the world of Brahmā.
Through virtuous conduct, one is honored and attains perfection in Brahmā.

transliteration: satyaena ca dharmeṇa jīvaḥ muktim āpnoti ||
translation_english: Through truthfulness and righteousness, the soul attains liberation.
Thus ends the fourth chapter of the Brahma Purāṇa.

sanskrit_text: धर्ममार्गेण यः पुरुषः जीवति, स सिद्धिमाप्नोति।
transliteration: dharmamārgeṇa yaḥ puruṣaḥ jīvati, sa siddhim āpnoti ||
translation_english: A person who lives according to the path of righteousness attains perfection.
Through truthfulness alone, a person becomes steadfast on the path of liberation.
By virtuous deeds and merit, one attains purity.
Through yoga, one attains the presence of Brahmā and follows the path of liberation.
Truth and connection with Brahmā ensure success in spiritual practice.
One established in Brahmā remains steadfast on the path of action.
A person endowed with knowledge attains the world of Brahmā.
Through virtuous conduct and the path of knowledge, the soul is honored.
Those steadfast in righteousness live happily in the world.

transliteration: satyaena ca dharmeṇaiva jīvaḥ muktim āpnoti ||
translation_english: Through truth and righteous conduct, the soul attains liberation.
By virtuous deeds and merit, a person attains purity.
Controlled by ignorance, beings fall into suffering.
Through yoga, one reaches the presence of Brahmā and follows the path of liberation.
Truth and connection with Brahmā ensure success in spiritual practice.
One established in Brahmā remains steadfast on the path of action.
A person endowed with knowledge attains the world of Brahmā.
Through virtuous conduct, one is honored and attains perfection in Brahmā.

transliteration: satyaena ca dharmeṇa jīvaḥ muktim āpnoti ||
translation_english: Through truthfulness and righteousness, the soul attains liberation.
Thus ends the fifth chapter of the Brahma Purāṇa.

sanskrit_text: धर्ममार्गेण यः पुरुषः जीवति, स सिद्धिमाप्नोति।
transliteration: dharmamārgeṇa yaḥ puruṣaḥ jīvati, sa siddhim āpnoti ||
translation_english: A person who lives according to the path of righteousness attains perfection.
A person steadfast in truth attains peace on the path of liberation.

sanskrit_text: ध्यानयोगेन साधकः आत्मानं ज्ञात्वा मुक्तिं प्राप्नोति।
transliteration: dhyānayogena sādhakaḥ ātmānaṃ jñātvā muktim āpnoti ||
translation_english: Through meditation and yoga, the practitioner knows the self and attains liberation.
Through righteous action, a person attains the fruits of merit.

sanskrit_text: सदाचारैः पूज्यते जीवः ब्रह्मसिद्धिं प्राप्नोति च।
transliteration: sadācāraiḥ pūjyate jīvaḥ brahma-siddhiṃ prāpnoti ca ||
translation_english: Through virtuous conduct, the soul is honored and attains perfection in Brahmā.
Steadfast on the path of righteousness, a person attains perfection in yoga.
A person holding firm to true knowledge remains steadfast on the path of liberation.
Through adherence to truth, a person attains inner strength.
By virtuous deeds and merit, a person attains purity.

sanskrit_text: योगिनः सर्वत्र पूज्यते, तेषां न संशयः।
transliteration: yoginaḥ sarvatra pūjyate, teṣāṃ na saṃśayaḥ ||
translation_english: Yogis are honored everywhere; there is no doubt about their reverence.
Through meditation, a person attains the presence of Brahmā.
By following truth and vows, one remains steadfast on the path of righteousness.
Through virtuous deeds, the soul remains steadfast on the path of liberation.
Holding to true knowledge, one attains the presence of Brahmā.
Steadfast on the path of righteousness, one attains perfection in yoga.
Through virtuous conduct, the soul is honored and attains Brahmā’s perfection.

sanskrit_text: ध्यानयोगेन साधकः आत्मानं ज्ञात्वा मुक्तिं प्राप्नोति।
transliteration: dhyānayogena sādhakaḥ ātmānaṃ jñātvā muktim āpnoti ||
translation_english: Through meditation and yoga, the practitioner knows the self and attains liberation.
A person holding firm to true knowledge remains steadfast on the path of liberation.
By virtuous deeds and merit, a person attains purity.
Through adherence to truth, a person attains inner strength.
Thus ends the sixth chapter of the Brahma Purāṇa.

sanskrit_text: सत्यं धर्मं च यज्ञश्च जीवो ब्रह्मसन्निधानम्।
transliteration: satyaṃ dharmaṃ ca yajñaśca jīvo brahma-sannidhānam ||
translation_english: Truth, righteousness, and sacrifice are the essence of life and the presence of Brahmā.
Through the practice of yoga, a practitioner attains the supreme abode.
By virtuous conduct, the soul is honored and remains steadfast on the path of liberation.
Through meditation and yoga, the practitioner attains perfection in Brahmā.
A person holding firm to true knowledge remains steadfast on the path of liberation.
Through adherence to truth, a person attains inner strength.
Steadfast on the path of righteousness, one attains perfection in yoga.
By virtuous deeds and merit, a person attains purity.
Holding to true knowledge, one attains the presence of Brahmā.
Through virtuous deeds, the soul remains steadfast on the path of liberation.

sanskrit_text: योगिनः सर्वत्र पूज्यते, तेषां न संशयः।
transliteration: yoginaḥ sarvatra pūjyate, teṣāṃ na saṃśayaḥ ||
translation_english: Yogis are honored everywhere; there is no doubt about their reverence.

sanskrit_text: ध्यानयोगेन साधकः आत्मानं ज्ञात्वा मुक्तिं प्राप्नोति।
transliteration: dhyānayogena sādhakaḥ ātmānaṃ jñātvā muktim āpnoti ||
translation_english: Through meditation, the practitioner knows the self and attains liberation.
By following truth and vows, one remains steadfast on the path of righteousness.
Through virtuous conduct and merit, a person attains purity.
A practitioner of yoga holding true knowledge remains steadfast on the path of liberation.
By virtuous conduct, the soul is honored and attains perfection in Brahmā.
Through meditation, the practitioner attains the presence of Brahmā.
A person holding firm to true knowledge remains steadfast on the path of liberation.
Through virtuous deeds, a person attains purity.
Thus ends the seventh chapter of the Brahma Purāṇa.

sanskrit_text: ऋषय ऊचुः— भगवन् धर्मतत्त्वं नः विस्तार्य कथय प्रभो।
transliteration: ṛṣaya ūcuḥ — bhagavan dharmatattvaṃ naḥ vistārya kathaya prabho ||
translation_english: The sages said: O Lord, kindly explain to us in detail the true nature of righteousness.

sanskrit_text: येन मार्गेण गच्छन्ति नराः स्वर्गं परां गतिम्।
transliteration: yena mārgeṇa gacchanti narāḥ svargaṃ parāṃ gatim ||
translation_english: Which path should humans follow to attain heaven and the supreme goal?

sanskrit_text: ब्रह्मोवाच— धर्मः सत्यं तपो दानं शौचं क्षान्तिरहिंसा।
transliteration: brahmovāca — dharmaḥ satyaṃ tapo dānaṃ śaucaṃ kṣāntirahiṃsā ||
translation_english: Brahmā said: Righteousness consists of truth, austerity, charity, purity, patience, and non-violence.
For those firmly established in these virtues, liberation is assured.
A person devoted to sacrifice, charity, and austerity attains heaven.

sanskrit_text: नित्यं धर्मे स्थितो यस्तु स याति ब्रह्मणः पदम्।
transliteration: nityaṃ dharme sthito yastu sa yāti brahmaṇaḥ padam ||
translation_english: One who constantly abides in righteousness attains the abode of Brahmā.

sanskrit_text: अहिंसा परमो धर्मः सर्वभूतेषु यः स्मृतः।
transliteration: ahiṃsā paramo dharmaḥ sarvabhūteṣu yaḥ smṛtaḥ ||
translation_english: Non-violence is declared the highest form of righteousness toward all beings.

transliteration: santoṣaḥ paramaṃ saukhyaṃ dharmasya mūlam ucyate ||
translation_english: Contentment is the greatest happiness and is said to be the root of dharma.

sanskrit_text: यः परेषां प्रियं कुर्यात् स धर्मात्मा प्रकीर्तितः।
transliteration: yaḥ pareṣāṃ priyaṃ kuryāt sa dharmātmā prakīrtitaḥ ||
translation_english: He who acts for the welfare of others is called truly righteous.

sanskrit_text: धर्मेण जीवितं येषां तेषां न भयमस्ति वै।
transliteration: dharmeṇa jīvitaṃ yeṣāṃ teṣāṃ na bhayam asti vai ||
translation_english: Those who live by righteousness are free from fear.

sanskrit_text: कर्मणा मनसा वाचा धर्म एव विधीयते।
transliteration: karmaṇā manasā vācā dharma eva vidhīyate ||
translation_english: Righteousness is practiced through action, thought, and speech.
Thus, righteousness has been explained as the giver of the world of Brahmā.

transliteration: śraddhayā yaḥ paṭhennityaṃ sa dharma-phalam aśnute ||
translation_english: One who regularly studies this with faith attains the fruits of righteousness.
Merit, fame, and long life arise from listening to teachings of dharma.
Dharma protects those who protect it and brings welfare to all worlds.
The entire universe, moving and unmoving, is rooted in righteousness.

transliteration: tasmād dharmaḥ sadā sevyo mānavaiḥ sukhakāmyayā ||
translation_english: Therefore, humans seeking happiness should always practice righteousness.

sanskrit_text: धर्मेण लभते कीर्तिं धर्मेण लभते गतिम्।
transliteration: dharmeṇa labhate kīrtiṃ dharmeṇa labhate gatim ||
translation_english: Through righteousness one gains fame, and through righteousness one attains liberation.

sanskrit_text: धर्मेण हीनः पुरुषः पशुभिः सम उच्यते।
transliteration: dharmeṇa hīnaḥ puruṣaḥ paśubhiḥ sama ucyate ||
translation_english: A person devoid of righteousness is said to be equal to an animal.
Thus ends the eighth chapter of the Brahma Purāṇa.

sanskrit_text: धर्मे स्थितस्य पुरुषस्य न कदाचिद् विनाशनम्।
transliteration: dharme sthitasya puruṣasya na kadācid vināśanam ||
translation_english: One who remains established in righteousness is never destroyed.

sanskrit_text: धर्मेण जयते लोकान् धर्मेण जयते परम्।
transliteration: dharmeṇa jayate lokān dharmeṇa jayate param ||
translation_english: Through righteousness one conquers the worlds, and through righteousness one attains the Supreme.

sanskrit_text: न धर्मात् परमो लाभो न धर्मात् परमा गतिः।
transliteration: na dharmāt paramo lābho na dharmāt paramā gatiḥ ||
translation_english: There is no gain higher than righteousness, and no destination greater than righteousness.

sanskrit_text: धर्मेण धार्यते लोकः सचराचर एव हि।
transliteration: dharmeṇa dhāryate lokaḥ sacarācara eva hi ||
translation_english: Indeed, the entire world—moving and unmoving—is sustained by righteousness.
Kings rule the earth for the protection of righteousness.

sanskrit_text: धर्महीनं नृपं लोकाः क्षिप्रं त्यजन्ति दुःखिताः।
transliteration: dharmahīnaṃ nṛpaṃ lokāḥ kṣipraṃ tyajanti duḥkhitāḥ ||
translation_english: People quickly abandon a ruler devoid of righteousness, suffering under his rule.

transliteration: dharmayukto nṛpo loke kīrtiṃ yaś cādhigacchati ||
translation_english: A righteous king attains fame and honor in the world.

sanskrit_text: धर्म एव गुरुः श्रेष्ठो धर्म एव पिता स्मृतः।
transliteration: dharma eva guruḥ śreṣṭho dharma eva pitā smṛtaḥ ||
translation_english: Righteousness itself is the greatest teacher and is regarded as one’s true father.

sanskrit_text: धर्म एव सखा लोके धर्म एव परायणम्।
transliteration: dharma eva sakhā loke dharma eva parāyaṇam ||
translation_english: Righteousness alone is one’s friend in the world and one’s ultimate refuge.
By taking refuge in righteousness, a person is freed from all suffering.
Righteousness is verily Nārāyaṇa Himself, acting for the welfare of all worlds.

sanskrit_text: धर्मे स्थिताः प्रसीदन्ति देवा अपि न संशयः।
transliteration: dharme sthitāḥ prasīdanti devā api na saṃśayaḥ ||
translation_english: Even the gods are pleased with those established in righteousness—there is no doubt.
Through righteousness and austerity, all accomplishments arise.

transliteration: dharmamūlaṃ jagat sarvaṃ dharme sarvaṃ pratiṣṭhitam ||
translation_english: The entire universe is rooted in righteousness; everything stands upon it.

sanskrit_text: य एवं वेत्ति धर्मस्य महत्त्वं स विमुच्यते।
transliteration: ya evaṃ vetti dharmasya mahatvaṃ sa vimucyate ||
translation_english: One who truly understands the greatness of righteousness attains liberation.
By merely hearing about righteousness, heaps of sin are destroyed.
Upon hearing teachings of righteousness, a person becomes pure.

transliteration: dharmeṇa saha mokṣaś ca svargaś caiva prajāyate ||
translation_english: With righteousness come both liberation and heaven.

sanskrit_text: धर्म एव परं तत्त्वं ब्रह्मणा परिकीर्तितम्।
transliteration: dharma eva paraṃ tattvaṃ brahmaṇā parikīrtitam ||
translation_english: Righteousness alone is the supreme truth, as proclaimed by Brahmā.
Thus ends this teaching on righteousness as declared by Brahmā.
Thus ends the eighth chapter of the Brahma Purāṇa.

sanskrit_text: ऋषय ऊचुः— सर्गं वंशान् मनूंश्चैव विस्तार्य कथय प्रभो।
transliteration: ṛṣaya ūcuḥ — sargaṃ vaṃśān manūṃś caiva vistārya kathaya prabho ||
translation_english: The sages said: O Lord, please explain in detail the creation, lineages, and the Manus.

sanskrit_text: ब्रह्मोवाच— आदौ नारायणः सृष्टिं स्वेच्छया समकल्पयत्।
transliteration: brahmovāca — ādau nārāyaṇaḥ sṛṣṭiṃ svecchayā samakalpayat ||
translation_english: Brahmā said: In the beginning, Nārāyaṇa willed the creation by His own desire.
From the unmanifest arose Brahmā, the self-born creator.
He is known as Hiraṇyagarbha, the creator of the universe.

transliteration: manasā sṛṣṭim ādāya prajāḥ sasarja cātmavān ||
translation_english: Using his mind, the self-possessed Brahmā created living beings.

sanskrit_text: मरीच्यादीन् ऋषीन् पूर्वं मानसाः ससृजे प्रभुः।
transliteration: marīcyādīn ṛṣīn pūrvaṃ mānasāḥ sasarje prabhuḥ ||
translation_english: First, the Lord created the mind-born sages such as Marīci.

transliteration: tebhyaḥ prajāḥ prasūyante sthāvarāḥ jaṅgamās tathā ||
translation_english: From them arose all beings—both immobile and mobile.
The Manus became the lawgivers, devoted to preserving creation.

sanskrit_text: स्वायम्भुवो मनुः पूर्वं लोकस्य प्रभवो मतः।
transliteration: svāyambhuvo manuḥ pūrvaṃ lokasya prabhavo mataḥ ||
translation_english: Svāyambhuva Manu is regarded as the first progenitor of the world.
From him arose the Ikṣvāku lineage, the Solar dynasty.
The Lunar dynasty arose from Soma, O sage.
These great dynasties upheld righteousness upon the earth.
The earth consists of seven continents surrounded by seven oceans.
Mount Meru, the king of mountains, stands at the center of the worlds.

sanskrit_text: लोकालोकः परो लोको यत्र सूर्यः न दृश्यते।
transliteration: lokālokaḥ paro loko yatra sūryaḥ na dṛśyate ||
translation_english: Beyond the known world lies Lokāloka, where the sun does not shine.

sanskrit_text: कालः सृष्टिं लयं चैव नियच्छति न संशयः।
transliteration: kālaḥ sṛṣṭiṃ layaṃ caiva niyacchati na saṃśayaḥ ||
translation_english: Time governs both creation and dissolution without doubt.
At the end of a cosmic age, all beings dissolve into eternal Viṣṇu.
Thus the process of creation has been properly explained, O great sages.

sanskrit_text: य एतत् शृणुयान्नित्यं स ज्ञानं लभते परम्।
transliteration: ya etat śṛṇuyān nityaṃ sa jñānaṃ labhate param ||
translation_english: One who regularly hears this attains supreme knowledge.

sanskrit_text: सृष्टिकथां समालोच्य पापैः स मुच्यते नरः।
transliteration: sṛṣṭi-kathāṃ samālocya pāpaiḥ sa mucyate naraḥ ||
translation_english: By contemplating the account of creation, a person is freed from sins.

sanskrit_text: भूर् भुवः स्वः इति ख्याता लोकास्त्रय उदाहृताः।
transliteration: bhūr bhuvaḥ svaḥ iti khyātā lokās traya udāhṛtāḥ ||
translation_english: The three worlds are known as Bhūr, Bhuvaḥ, and Svaḥ.

transliteration: mahar janas tapaḥ satyaṃ kramaśaḥ parikīrtitam ||
translation_english: Above them are the realms of Mahar, Jana, Tapa, and Satya.

sanskrit_text: एषां मध्ये स्थितो मेरुः प्रकाशो लोकदीपकः।
transliteration: eṣāṃ madhye sthito meruḥ prakāśo loka-dīpakaḥ ||
translation_english: Among these worlds stands Mount Meru, illuminating all realms.

transliteration: devāḥ meruṃ samāśritya nivasanti saha ṛṣibhiḥ ||
translation_english: The gods dwell upon Meru along with sages.
The sun circles Mount Meru like the wheel of time.
From this movement arise days, nights, months, seasons, and years.
The moon nourishes beings by assuming the form of Soma.

transliteration: vāyur annaṃ pacaty atra prāṇa-rūpeṇa saṃsthitaḥ ||
translation_english: Vāyu digests food by dwelling within beings as vital breath.
Agni resides in all bodies as Vaiśvānara, sustaining life.

sanskrit_text: जलमन्नं स्मृतं देवैः प्राणानां धारणं परम्।
transliteration: jalam annaṃ smṛtaṃ devaiḥ prāṇānāṃ dhāraṇaṃ param ||
translation_english: Water is considered food by the gods and the supreme support of life.
The Earth supports all beings and is filled with sacred merit.
These five great elements govern creation, preservation, and dissolution.
This moving and unmoving world is composed of the three guṇas.

transliteration: sattvaṃ rajas tamaś caiva pravartante yathākramam ||
translation_english: Sattva, Rajas, and Tamas operate in due order.

sanskrit_text: सत्त्वात् ज्ञानं रजः कर्म तमसो मोह उच्यते।
transliteration: sattvāt jñānaṃ rajaḥ karma tamaso moha ucyate ||
translation_english: From Sattva arises knowledge, from Rajas action, and from Tamas delusion.

sanskrit_text: एतद् गुणमयं विश्वं ज्ञात्वा मुच्येत पण्डितः।
transliteration: etad guṇa-mayaṃ viśvaṃ jñātvā mucyeta paṇḍitaḥ ||
translation_english: The wise are liberated by understanding this guṇa-based universe.
Beings enveloped by ignorance remain bound to worldly existence.
Through true knowledge they are liberated and attain Viṣṇu’s abode.

sanskrit_text: विष्णुः सर्वगतः शुद्धो जगतः कारणं परम्।
transliteration: viṣṇuḥ sarva-gataḥ śuddho jagataḥ kāraṇaṃ param ||
translation_english: Viṣṇu is all-pervading, pure, and the supreme cause of the universe.

transliteration: evaṃ brahmāṇḍam ākhyātaṃ mayā te muni-sattamāḥ ||
translation_english: Thus the nature of the cosmic universe has been explained to you, O great sages.
Thus ends the ninth chapter of the Brahma Purāṇa.

sanskrit_text: सूत उवाच। मन्वन्तराणि वक्ष्यामि यथावत् क्रमशः शुभम्।
transliteration: sūta uvāca | manvantarāṇi vakṣyāmi yathāvat kramaśaḥ śubham ||
translation_english: Sūta said: I shall now describe the Manvantaras in proper and auspicious order.

sanskrit_text: स्वायम्भुवो मनुः पूर्वं लोकान् धर्मे न्यवेशयत्।
transliteration: svāyambhuvo manuḥ pūrvaṃ lokān dharme nyaveśayat ||
translation_english: First was Svāyambhuva Manu, who established the worlds in righteousness.

sanskrit_text: तस्य पुत्राः प्रजाः सर्वाः धर्ममार्गे प्रतिष्ठिताः।
transliteration: tasya putrāḥ prajāḥ sarvāḥ dharmamārge pratiṣṭhitāḥ ||
translation_english: His sons and all beings were firmly established on the path of dharma.
Priyavrata and Uttānapāda became the progenitors of his lineage.

transliteration: priyavratasya putrās tu sapta dvīpān vibhaktavān ||
translation_english: The sons of Priyavrata divided the earth into seven continents.
Dhruva, the son of Uttānapāda, became renowned and celebrated in all worlds.

sanskrit_text: ध्रुवलोकं समासाद्य स्थिरतां प्राप सः ध्रुवः।
transliteration: dhruvalokaṃ samāsādya sthiratāṃ prāpa saḥ dhruvaḥ ||
translation_english: Attaining Dhruva-loka, he achieved eternal stability.

sanskrit_text: तस्य वंशे प्रजाः सर्वाः धर्मज्ञा लोकसंमताः।
transliteration: tasya vaṃśe prajāḥ sarvāḥ dharmajñā loka-sammatāḥ ||
translation_english: All beings in his lineage were righteous and honored by the world.

sanskrit_text: मनवो बहवो जाताः काले काले व्यवस्थिताः।
transliteration: manavo bahavo jātāḥ kāle kāle vyavasthitāḥ ||
translation_english: Many Manus arose in different ages, each established in their time.
Their governance of dharma ensured the welfare of all beings.

transliteration: manvantareṣu devāś ca ṛṣayaś ca pratiṣṭhitāḥ ||
translation_english: In each Manvantara, gods and sages were duly established.
Indras, suited to each Manu, were appointed to govern the world.
The seven sages, knowers of dharma, were devoted to preserving the worlds.

transliteration: evaṃ manvantarāṇy uktvā vaṃśān vakṣyāmy ataḥ param ||
translation_english: Having thus described the Manvantaras, I shall now speak of the dynasties.
The Solar and Lunar dynasties bestowed great fame upon kings.
Those born in these lineages were righteous and renowned in the world.

transliteration: rājarṣayaś ca bahavo jagataḥ pālanaṃ gatāḥ ||
translation_english: Many royal sages arose, devoted to protecting the world.
Ruling the earth through dharma, they attained lasting glory.

sanskrit_text: एषा सृष्टिः पुरा प्रोक्ता ब्रह्मणा लोककारिणा।
transliteration: eṣā sṛṣṭiḥ purā proktā brahmaṇā loka-kāriṇā ||
translation_english: This creation was spoken of long ago by Brahmā, the creator of worlds.

sanskrit_text: अतः परं प्रवक्ष्यामि वंशानां विस्तरं शुभम्।
transliteration: ataḥ paraṃ pravakṣyāmi vaṃśānāṃ vistaraṃ śubham ||
translation_english: Hereafter, I shall describe the detailed and auspicious genealogies.
In the Solar dynasty, valiant royal sages were always renowned.

sanskrit_text: महर्षयः सन्तु ते सर्वे धर्मे स्थितिसंपन्नाः।
transliteration: maharṣayaḥ santu te sarve dharme sthiti-sampannāḥ ||
translation_english: All these great sages were firmly established in dharma.
Kings of the Lunar dynasty attained great fame.

sanskrit_text: तेषां पुत्राः प्रजाः च धर्मे प्रतिष्ठिताः सदा।
transliteration: teṣāṃ putrāḥ prajāḥ ca dharme pratiṣṭhitāḥ sadā ||
translation_english: Their sons and all subjects were always established in dharma.

transliteration: manuśrīṇāṃ vaṃśe devāḥ saptarṣayaś ca vai ||
translation_english: In the noble line of Manus, gods and the seven sages were present.
When they were active in dharma, world protection reached perfection.

sanskrit_text: राजर्षयः प्रजाः च पृथिवीं पालयन्ति धर्मतः।
transliteration: rājarṣayaḥ prajāḥ ca pṛthivīṃ pālayanti dharmataḥ ||
translation_english: Royal sages and kings govern the earth according to dharma.

sanskrit_text: सर्वे राजानः शूरा धर्मसिद्धिं प्रयान्ति च।
transliteration: sarve rājānaḥ śūrā dharma-siddhiṃ prayānti ca ||
translation_english: All courageous kings advance toward perfection in dharma.

sanskrit_text: तेषां वंशे बहवो प्रजाः लोकहिते प्रतिष्ठिताः।
transliteration: teṣāṃ vaṃśe bahavo prajāḥ lokahite pratiṣṭhitāḥ ||
translation_english: In their lineage, many subjects were established for the welfare of the world.

sanskrit_text: ते वंशाः पुरा वर्णिताः ब्रह्मणो देवतासु च।
transliteration: te vaṃśāḥ purā varṇitāḥ brahmaṇo devatāsu ca ||
translation_english: These dynasties were described long ago by Brahmā among the gods.
The Solar dynasty attains fame, being righteous and beloved of the people.
The Lunar dynasty too was always established by numerous people.
May all royal sages be firmly established in dharma.
May their sons be valiant and endowed with fame.

sanskrit_text: एवं वंशाः संप्राप्ताः धर्मज्ञा लोकहिते सदा।
transliteration: evaṃ vaṃśāḥ saṃprāptāḥ dharmajñā lokahite sadā ||
translation_english: Thus the dynasties have always been established, righteous, and for the welfare of the world.
I now describe the dynasties in sequence for those who listen.

sanskrit_text: मन्वन्तराणि च वक्ष्यामि परं पितृभ्यः सदा।
transliteration: manvantarāṇi ca vakṣyāmi paraṃ pitṛbhyaḥ sadā ||
translation_english: I shall describe the Manvantaras and their supreme lineage for the forefathers.

sanskrit_text: एते वंशाः पुरा प्रोक्ताः ब्रह्मणा लोककारिणा।
transliteration: ete vaṃśāḥ purā proktāḥ brahmaṇā loka-kāriṇā ||
translation_english: These dynasties were described long ago by Brahmā, the benefactor of worlds.

sanskrit_text: सत्यं धर्मं च युक्त्वा लोकहिते प्रवर्तिताः।
transliteration: satyaṃ dharmaṃ ca yuktvā lokahite pravartitāḥ ||
translation_english: Righteous and truthful, they acted always for the welfare of the world.
Thus ends the tenth chapter of the Brahma Purāṇa.

sanskrit_text: सूत उवाच। वक्ष्यामि राजर्षीनां वंशानुक्रमेण शुभम्।
transliteration: sūta uvāca | vakṣyāmi rājarṣīnāṃ vaṃśānukrameṇa śubham ||
translation_english: Sūta said: I shall now describe the genealogies of royal sages in proper order.
The Manvantaras had arrived, and all were firmly established in dharma.
Their royal sages acted for the welfare of the world.
Kings of the Solar dynasty attained perfection in dharma.
Kings of the Lunar dynasty were established for the welfare of their subjects.

transliteration: manuśrīṇāṃ vaṃśe devāś ca saptarṣayaś ca santu ||
translation_english: In the lineage of noble Manus, gods and the seven sages were present.
When they acted according to dharma, world protection reached perfection.
May all royal sages be firmly established in dharma.
May their sons be valiant and endowed with fame.

sanskrit_text: सर्वे राजर्षयः धर्मे स्थिराः लोकहिते च।
transliteration: sarve rājarṣayaḥ dharme sthirāḥ lokahite ca ||
translation_english: All royal sages remain steadfast in dharma for the welfare of the world.
Kings of the Solar dynasty always acted for the welfare of their subjects.
Kings of the Lunar dynasty attained perfection in dharma.

sanskrit_text: तेषां पुत्राः प्रजाः च धर्मे प्रतिष्ठिताः सदा।
transliteration: teṣāṃ putrāḥ prajāḥ ca dharme pratiṣṭhitāḥ sadā ||
translation_english: Their sons and all subjects were always established in dharma.

transliteration: manuśrīṇāṃ vaṃśe devāḥ saptarṣayaś ca vai ||
translation_english: In the noble line of Manus, gods and the seven sages were present.
When they acted in dharma, world protection reached excellence.
May all royal sages be firmly established in dharma.
May their sons be valiant and endowed with fame.

sanskrit_text: सर्वे राजर्षयः धर्मे स्थिराः लोकहिते च।
transliteration: sarve rājarṣayaḥ dharme sthirāḥ lokahite ca ||
translation_english: All royal sages remain steadfast in dharma for the welfare of the world.

sanskrit_text: एवं वंशाः पुरा वर्णिताः धर्मज्ञा लोकहिते सदा।
transliteration: evaṃ vaṃśāḥ purā varṇitāḥ dharmajñā lokahite sadā ||
translation_english: Thus these dynasties were described long ago, righteous and for the welfare of the world.
Thus ends the eleventh chapter of the Brahma Purāṇa.
In their dynasties, royal sages acted continuously for the welfare of the world.
Kings of the Solar dynasty attained perfection in dharma.
Kings of the Lunar dynasty were established for the welfare of their subjects.

transliteration: manuśrīṇāṃ vaṃśe devāś ca saptarṣayaś ca santu ||
translation_english: In the noble line of Manus, gods and the seven sages were present.
When they acted in dharma, world protection reached excellence.
May all royal sages be firmly established in dharma.
May their sons be valiant and endowed with fame.

sanskrit_text: सर्वे राजर्षयः धर्मे स्थिराः लोकहिते च।
transliteration: sarve rājarṣayaḥ dharme sthirāḥ lokahite ca ||
translation_english: All royal sages remain steadfast in dharma for the welfare of the world.
Kings of the Solar dynasty acted continuously for the welfare of their subjects.
Kings of the Lunar dynasty attained perfection in dharma.

sanskrit_text: तेषां पुत्राः प्रजाः च धर्मे प्रतिष्ठिताः सदा।
transliteration: teṣāṃ putrāḥ prajāḥ ca dharme pratiṣṭhitāḥ sadā ||
translation_english: Their sons and subjects were always established in dharma.

transliteration: manuśrīṇāṃ vaṃśe devāś ca saptarṣayaś ca vai ||
translation_english: In the line of noble Manus, gods and the seven sages were present.
When they acted in dharma, world protection reached perfection.
May all royal sages be firmly established in dharma.
May their sons be valiant and renowned.

sanskrit_text: सर्वे राजर्षयः धर्मे स्थिराः लोकहिते च।
transliteration: sarve rājarṣayaḥ dharme sthirāḥ lokahite ca ||
translation_english: All royal sages remain steadfast in dharma for the welfare of the world.

sanskrit_text: एवं वंशाः पुरा वर्णिताः धर्मज्ञा लोकहिते सदा।
transliteration: evaṃ vaṃśāḥ purā varṇitāḥ dharmajñā lokahite sadā ||
translation_english: Thus the dynasties were described long ago, righteous and for the welfare of the world.
Thus ends the twelfth chapter of the Brahma Purāṇa.
Thus the twelfth chapter has been completed, read with devotion.
May all readers attain merit and perfection in dharma.
Now begins the thirteenth chapter of the Brahma Purāṇa.

sanskrit_text: कालस्य स्वरूपं विप्राणां ब्रह्मा सम्यगुवाच ह।
transliteration: kālasya svarūpaṃ viprāṇāṃ brahmā samyag uvāca ha ||
translation_english: Brahmā clearly explained to the sages the true nature of Time.

sanskrit_text: कालः सृजति भूतानि काल एव विनाशकृत्।
transliteration: kālaḥ sṛjati bhūtāni kāla eva vināśakṛt ||
translation_english: Time creates all beings, and Time itself causes their destruction.

sanskrit_text: कालातीतं परं ब्रह्म न कालेन विनश्यति।
transliteration: kālātītaṃ paraṃ brahma na kālena vinaśyati ||
translation_english: The Supreme Brahman transcends time and is never destroyed by it.

sanskrit_text: युगानि च चतुर्विप्राः कीर्तयामास स प्रभुः।
transliteration: yugāni ca catur viprāḥ kīrtayāmāsa sa prabhuḥ ||
translation_english: The Lord then described the four Yugas to the sages.

sanskrit_text: कृतं त्रेता द्वापरं च कलिश्च क्रमशः स्मृताः।
transliteration: kṛtaṃ tretā dvāparaṃ ca kaliś ca kramaśaḥ smṛtāḥ ||
translation_english: Kṛta, Tretā, Dvāpara, and Kali are remembered in that order.
In the Kṛta Yuga, dharma stands firmly on all four legs.

sanskrit_text: त्रेतायां पादहीनः स्याद् द्वापरे द्वौ विनश्यतः।
transliteration: tretāyāṃ pāda-hīnaḥ syād dvāpare dvau vinaśyataḥ ||
translation_english: In Tretā one leg is lost, and in Dvāpara two legs decline.

sanskrit_text: कलौ तु पादमात्रेण धर्मः तिष्ठति दुर्बलः।
transliteration: kalau tu pāda-mātreṇa dharmaḥ tiṣṭhati durbalaḥ ||
translation_english: In Kali Yuga, dharma survives weakly on only one leg.

sanskrit_text: सत्यं दया तपो दानं युगे युगे विनश्यति।
transliteration: satyaṃ dayā tapo dānaṃ yuge yuge vinaśyati ||
translation_english: Truth, compassion, austerity, and charity decline with each Yuga.

sanskrit_text: कलेर्दोषनिधे राजन् धर्मो नामैक एव हि।
transliteration: kaler doṣa-nidhe rājan dharmo nāmaika eva hi ||
translation_english: O King, Kali is an ocean of faults, yet one form of dharma remains.
Remembrance of Hari’s name is the supreme means of liberation.

sanskrit_text: यज्ञाः कृतयुगे प्रोक्ता त्रेतायां तप उच्यते।
transliteration: yajñāḥ kṛta-yuge proktā tretāyāṃ tapa ucyate ||
translation_english: Sacrifice dominates Kṛta Yuga, while austerity prevails in Tretā.

sanskrit_text: द्वापरे परिचर्या स्यात् कलौ दानं विशिष्यते।
transliteration: dvāpare paricaryā syāt kalau dānaṃ viśiṣyate ||
translation_english: Service defines Dvāpara Yuga, while charity excels in Kali.
Thus the duties of the Yugas were declared by Brahmā for the world's welfare.
The sequence of Manvantaras is then briefly described.
Fourteen Manus arise in each Kalpa of Brahmā.
Each Manvantara has its own Indra and seven sages.
Thus the divisions of time were expounded by Brahmā.

transliteration: etad vijñāya dharmātmā mucyate nātra saṃśayaḥ ||
translation_english: One who understands this with righteousness is liberated—without doubt.

sanskrit_text: कालो हि सर्वभूतानां प्रभवो नाश एव च।
transliteration: kālo hi sarva-bhūtānāṃ prabhavo nāśa eva ca ||
translation_english: Time alone is the source and the destroyer of all beings.

transliteration: na kaścit kālam atikramya jīvituṃ śaknoti hi ||
translation_english: No one can live by surpassing the power of Time.

sanskrit_text: सर्गे स्थितौ लये चैव कालः कारणमुच्यते।
transliteration: sarge sthitau laye caiva kālaḥ kāraṇam ucyate ||
translation_english: In creation, preservation, and dissolution, Time is declared the cause.

transliteration: brahmā viṣṇuś ca rudraś ca kālasya vaśa-vartinaḥ ||
translation_english: Brahmā, Viṣṇu, and Rudra act under the governance of Time.

transliteration: kālāt parataraṃ brahma nityaṃ śāśvatam avyayam ||
translation_english: Beyond Time exists the eternal, imperishable Supreme Brahman.

transliteration: tad brahma jñāyate yogaiḥ śuddha-cittair mahātmabhiḥ ||
translation_english: That Brahman is realized through yoga by pure-minded great souls.
Bound by Time, the individual soul is tied by the bonds of karma.

sanskrit_text: ज्ञानदीपेन तं पाशं छित्त्वा मुक्तो भवेत् नरः।
transliteration: jñāna-dīpena taṃ pāśaṃ chittvā mukto bhavet naraḥ ||
translation_english: By the lamp of knowledge, one cuts these bonds and becomes liberated.

sanskrit_text: न कर्मणा न संतानेन न धनेन विमुच्यते।
transliteration: na karmaṇā na saṃtānena na dhanena vimucyate ||
translation_english: Neither action, progeny, nor wealth can grant liberation.

sanskrit_text: ज्ञानेनैव तु कैवल्यं प्राप्यते नात्र संशयः।
transliteration: jñānenaiva tu kaivalyaṃ prāpyate nātra saṃśayaḥ ||
translation_english: Liberation is attained only through knowledge—there is no doubt.
Knowledge united with devotion leads one to the path of liberation.
Through devotion to Viṣṇu, the bondage of Time is destroyed.

sanskrit_text: यः स्मरेत् पुण्डरीकाक्षं स याति परमां गतिम्।
transliteration: yaḥ smaret puṇḍarīkākṣaṃ sa yāti paramāṃ gatim ||
translation_english: One who remembers the Lotus-eyed Lord attains the supreme state.

sanskrit_text: न पुनर्जन्म संसारे तस्य विद्यते कचित्।
transliteration: na punar-janma saṃsāre tasya vidyate kvacit ||
translation_english: For such a soul, rebirth in this world no longer exists.
Thus dharma has been explained together with the principle of Time.
Hearing this sacred account frees one from sinful actions.

sanskrit_text: यः पठेन्नियतं भक्त्या स याति ब्रह्मणः पदम्।
transliteration: yaḥ paṭhen niyataṃ bhaktyā sa yāti brahmaṇaḥ padam ||
translation_english: One who regularly recites this with devotion reaches the abode of Brahman.
Thus the greatness of Time was proclaimed by Brahmā.
This was narrated long ago to the sages for the welfare of the worlds.
Thus ends the thirteenth chapter of the Brahma Purāṇa.
Brahmā said: Listen as I explain the principles of dharma combined with true knowledge.
By which realization alone one is freed from worldly existence.

sanskrit_text: धर्मः मूलं जगत्सर्वं धर्मे लोकाः प्रतिष्ठिताः।
transliteration: dharmaḥ mūlaṃ jagat sarvaṃ dharme lokāḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ ||
translation_english: Dharma is the foundation of the entire universe; all worlds rest upon dharma.
By dharma the world is sustained, and through dharma it prospers.

sanskrit_text: धर्महीनः क्षयं याति पुरुषो नात्र संशयः।
transliteration: dharma-hīnaḥ kṣayaṃ yāti puruṣo nātra saṃśayaḥ ||
translation_english: A person devoid of dharma meets destruction—there is no doubt.

sanskrit_text: सत्यं दानं तपः शौचं धर्मस्यैतानि लक्षणम्।
transliteration: satyaṃ dānaṃ tapaḥ śaucaṃ dharmasyaitāni lakṣaṇam ||
translation_english: Truth, charity, austerity, and purity are the marks of dharma.

sanskrit_text: एतेन मार्गेण नरो विष्णुलोकं स गच्छति।
transliteration: etena mārgeṇa naro viṣṇu-lokaṃ sa gacchati ||
translation_english: By following this path, a person attains the realm of Viṣṇu.
Knowledge united with devotion is said to be the means to liberation.

transliteration: na jñānaṃ bhakti-hīnasya na bhaktir jñāna-varjitā ||
translation_english: Knowledge without devotion is fruitless, and devotion without knowledge is incomplete.

transliteration: ubhābhyāṃ jāyate muktir nānyathā vidyate kvacit ||
translation_english: Liberation arises from both together; it is not attained otherwise.

transliteration: viṣṇuṃ sarveṣu bhūteṣu paśyann ātmānam āpnuyāt ||
translation_english: Seeing Viṣṇu in all beings, one realizes the Self.
Such a yogi sees all equally, free from hatred and attachment.

sanskrit_text: स एव मुक्त इत्युक्तः शास्त्रदृष्ट्या सुनिश्चितः।
transliteration: sa eva mukta ity uktaḥ śāstra-dṛṣṭyā niścitāḥ ||
translation_english: According to the scriptures, such a person alone is called liberated.

sanskrit_text: न गृहस्थो न संन्यासी केवलं धर्मवान् भवेत्।
transliteration: na gṛhastho na saṃnyāsī kevalaṃ dharmavān bhavet ||
translation_english: Neither householder nor renunciate matters—only righteousness does.

sanskrit_text: आचारेणैव शुद्धिः स्यात् न वेशेन न जातिभिः।
transliteration: ācāreṇaiva śuddhiḥ syāt na veśena na jātibhiḥ ||
translation_english: Purity arises from conduct alone, not from attire or birth.

sanskrit_text: यः सर्वभूतहिते रतः स वै ब्राह्मण उच्यते।
transliteration: yaḥ sarva-bhūta-hite rataḥ sa vai brāhmaṇa ucyate ||
translation_english: One devoted to the welfare of all beings is truly called a Brāhmaṇa.

sanskrit_text: एतद् धर्मस्य सारं तु कथितं ते महामुने।
transliteration: etad dharmasya sāraṃ tu kathitaṃ te mahāmune ||
translation_english: Thus the essence of dharma has been explained to you, O great sage.

transliteration: śrutvaitad dharmam ākhyānaṃ naraḥ pāpaiḥ pramucyate ||
translation_english: Hearing this discourse on dharma frees a person from sins.

sanskrit_text: धर्मे स्थितो नरः सम्यग् विष्णोः पदमवाप्नुयात्।
transliteration: dharme sthito naraḥ samyag viṣṇoḥ padam avāpnuyāt ||
translation_english: Established firmly in dharma, one attains the abode of Viṣṇu.
Thus begins the discourse on dharma as expounded long ago by Brahmā.
A person devoid of dharma becomes equal to a beast.
A human endowed with dharma is proclaimed equal to the gods.

sanskrit_text: न धर्मात् परमो लाभो न सुखं धर्मतः परम्।
transliteration: na dharmāt paramo lābho na sukhaṃ dharmataḥ param ||
translation_english: There is no gain higher than dharma, and no happiness greater than dharma.

sanskrit_text: धर्म एव हतो हन्ति धर्मो रक्षति रक्षितः।
transliteration: dharma eva hato hanti dharmo rakṣati rakṣitaḥ ||
translation_english: Dharma, when destroyed, destroys; when protected, it protects.

sanskrit_text: तस्माद्धर्मो न हन्तव्यो मा नो धर्मो हतोऽवधीत्।
transliteration: tasmād dharmo na hantavyo mā no dharmo hato’vadhīt ||
translation_english: Therefore dharma should never be destroyed, lest destroyed dharma destroy us.

sanskrit_text: धर्मो विष्णुः स्मृतो लोके विष्णुर्धर्मः सनातनः।
transliteration: dharmo viṣṇuḥ smṛto loke viṣṇur dharmaḥ sanātanaḥ ||
translation_english: Dharma is remembered as Viṣṇu in this world, and Viṣṇu is eternal dharma.

sanskrit_text: यः पश्यति हरिं सर्वत्र स पश्यति न संशयः।
transliteration: yaḥ paśyati hariṃ sarvatra sa paśyati na saṃśayaḥ ||
translation_english: One who sees Hari everywhere truly sees—there is no doubt.
Seeing the Self in all beings, one is called a knower of the Self.
Thus knowledge combined with dharma has been concisely proclaimed.

transliteration: jñānaṃ bhaktyā vinā śuṣkaṃ bhaktir jñāna-vivarjitā ||
translation_english: Knowledge without devotion is dry; devotion without knowledge is incomplete.
Perfection arises from the union of both, firmly established on the path of liberation.
Through devotion to Viṣṇu, the purified soul surely crosses worldly existence.
For such a one, rebirth due to karmic bondage does not occur again.
This dharma was thus declared by Brahmā for the welfare of the worlds.
Hearing this sacred teaching, one is freed from all sins.

sanskrit_text: पठन् वा श्रावयन् वापि धर्मलोकं स गच्छति।
transliteration: paṭhan vā śrāvayan vāpi dharma-lokaṃ sa gacchati ||
translation_english: Whether reciting or causing it to be heard, one attains the realm of dharma.

sanskrit_text: एतद् गुह्यतमं शास्त्रं न वक्तव्यं अभक्तये।
transliteration: etad guhyatamaṃ śāstraṃ na vaktavyaṃ abhaktaye ||
translation_english: This most secret teaching should not be spoken to the faithless.
It should be taught only to the devoted, humble, and faithful.

transliteration: ity uktvā brahmaṇā proktaṃ dharma-jñānam anuttamam ||
translation_english: Thus Brahmā concluded this supreme teaching of dharma and knowledge.
Thus ends the fourteenth chapter of the Brahma Purāṇa.

sanskrit_text: ब्रह्मोवाच। पुनरेव प्रवक्ष्यामि धर्मस्य परमं पदम्।
transliteration: brahmovāca | punar eva pravakṣyāmi dharmasya paramaṃ padam ||
translation_english: Brahmā said: Once again I shall explain the supreme state attained through dharma.
Having attained it, beings do not return to the ocean of worldly suffering.

sanskrit_text: अहिंसा सत्यवचनं दया शौचं क्षमा दमः।
transliteration: ahiṃsā satya-vacanaṃ dayā śaucaṃ kṣamā damaḥ ||
translation_english: Non-violence, truthfulness, compassion, purity, forgiveness, and self-restraint—

transliteration: etair dharma-pathaiḥ samyak viṣṇu-lokaṃ sa gacchati ||
translation_english: By these righteous paths, one surely attains the realm of Viṣṇu.

sanskrit_text: न तपांसि न दानानि न वेदाध्ययनं तथा।
transliteration: na tapāṃsi na dānāni na vedādhyayanaṃ tathā ||
translation_english: Neither austerities, nor charity, nor even Vedic study alone—
—can become causes of liberation for a person devoid of devotion.

sanskrit_text: भक्त्या तु केवया विष्णुः प्रसन्नः स्यात् न संशयः।
transliteration: bhaktyā tu kevalayā viṣṇuḥ prasannaḥ syāt na saṃśayaḥ ||
translation_english: Through pure devotion alone, Viṣṇu becomes pleased—there is no doubt.

transliteration: prasanne bhagavaty eva muktiḥ kara-sthitā nṛṇām ||
translation_english: When the Lord is pleased, liberation rests in the hands of humans.

sanskrit_text: न जात्या न तपोवेषैः न ज्ञानमात्रतः क्वचित्।
transliteration: na jātyā na tapo-veśaiḥ na jñāna-mātrataḥ kvacit ||
translation_english: Not by birth, nor by ascetic garb, nor by knowledge alone—

sanskrit_text: भक्त्या नारायणो ज्ञेयः सदा सर्वेषु देहिषु।
transliteration: bhaktyā nārāyaṇo jñeyaḥ sadā sarveṣu dehiṣu ||
translation_english: —but through devotion, Nārāyaṇa is realized within all beings.

sanskrit_text: यः पश्यति जगत्सर्वं विष्णुमयं स पश्यति।
transliteration: yaḥ paśyati jagat sarvaṃ viṣṇu-mayaṃ sa paśyati ||
translation_english: One who sees the entire universe as pervaded by Viṣṇu truly sees.

sanskrit_text: न तस्य मोहः संसारः कर्मबन्धो न विद्यते।
transliteration: na tasya mohaḥ saṃsāraḥ karma-bandho na vidyate ||
translation_english: For such a person, delusion, worldly bondage, and karma do not exist.
Seeing all equally, ever peaceful, devoted to the welfare of all beings.

sanskrit_text: स एव योगवित् प्रोक्तः स एव ब्रह्मविद् बुधैः।
transliteration: sa eva yoga-vit proktaḥ sa eva brahma-vit budhaiḥ ||
translation_english: Such a one is called a knower of yoga and a knower of Brahman by the wise.

sanskrit_text: न तस्य कर्तव्यं किञ्चिद् लोकेऽस्मिन् विद्यते पुनः।
transliteration: na tasya kartavyaṃ kiñcid loke’smin vidyate punaḥ ||
translation_english: For such a person, no obligatory duty remains in this world.
Renouncing all actions, one should fix the mind upon Viṣṇu.
Thus this yoga has been concisely explained, O best of sages.

sanskrit_text: श्रद्धया यो नरः शृणुयात् स याति परमां गतिम्।
transliteration: śraddhayā yo naraḥ śṛṇuyāt sa yāti paramāṃ gatim ||
translation_english: Whoever hears this with faith attains the supreme state.

sanskrit_text: पठन् वा श्रावयन् वापि विष्णुलोकं स गच्छति।
transliteration: paṭhan vā śrāvayan vāpi viṣṇu-lokaṃ sa gacchati ||
translation_english: Whether reciting or teaching it, one reaches the abode of Viṣṇu.
Thus begins the section on devotion as taught long ago by Brahmā.

sanskrit_text: मुनय ऊचुः। भगवन् कथ्यतां भक्तेर्लक्षणं यथातथम्।
transliteration: munaya ūcuḥ | bhagavan kathyatāṃ bhakter lakṣaṇaṃ yathā-tatham ||
translation_english: The sages said: O Lord, please describe correctly the characteristics of devotion.

sanskrit_text: यया जीवः परं ब्रह्म प्राप्नोति न पुनर्भवम्।
transliteration: yayā jīvaḥ paraṃ brahma prāpnoti na punar-bhavam ||
translation_english: By which the soul attains the Supreme Brahman and does not return to rebirth.

sanskrit_text: ब्रह्मोवाच। अहं ते संप्रवक्ष्यामि भक्तेः सूक्ष्मं स्वरूपकम्।
transliteration: brahmovāca | ahaṃ te saṃpravakṣyāmi bhakteḥ sūkṣmaṃ svarūpakam ||
translation_english: Brahmā said: I shall now explain to you the subtle nature of devotion.
Fixing the mind firmly on Viṣṇu with undivided concentration.
Narration of His names and qualities, chanting and constant remembrance.

sanskrit_text: सेवा पूजनमर्चा च वन्दनं च विशेषतः।
transliteration: sevā pūjanam arcā ca vandanaṃ ca viśeṣataḥ ||
translation_english: Service, worship, ritual offering, and reverential salutation in particular.

sanskrit_text: मैत्री सर्वेषु भूतेषु द्वेषाभावः सदैव च।
transliteration: maitrī sarveṣu bhūteṣu dveṣābhāvaḥ sadaiva ca ||
translation_english: Friendliness toward all beings and complete absence of hatred.

transliteration: saṃtoṣo laghu-bhāvaś ca ātmany eva pratiṣṭhitaḥ ||
translation_english: Contentment, humility, and firm establishment in the Self.
This supreme devotion is said to destroy birth and death.

transliteration: na sā kriyābhir āyāsair na ca jñāna-prapañcakaiḥ ||
translation_english: It is not attained by exhausting rituals nor by complex intellectualism.
It is offered through simplicity and a pure heart.

sanskrit_text: तस्मिन् भक्तिपरे जीवो न पश्यति परं सुखम्।
transliteration: tasmin bhakti-pare jīvo na paśyati paraṃ sukham ||
translation_english: For the soul devoted to bhakti, no happiness greater than this exists.

sanskrit_text: न शोको न भयः कश्चित् न स्पृहा न च मत्सरः।
transliteration: na śoko na bhayaḥ kaścit na spṛhā na ca matsaraḥ ||
translation_english: Neither sorrow nor fear, neither craving nor envy remains.

sanskrit_text: भक्तेः प्रभावात्सर्वेषां दोषाणां क्षय एव हि।
transliteration: bhakteḥ prabhāvāt sarveṣāṃ doṣāṇāṃ kṣaya eva hi ||
translation_english: By the power of devotion, all faults are completely destroyed.

sanskrit_text: यत्र भक्तिर्निवसति तत्र विष्णुः स्वयं स्थितः।
transliteration: yatra bhaktir nivasati tatra viṣṇuḥ svayaṃ sthitaḥ ||
translation_english: Where devotion resides, Viṣṇu Himself dwells there.

sanskrit_text: विष्णौ स्थितं जगत्सर्वं भक्त्या ज्ञायते बुधैः।
transliteration: viṣṇau sthitaṃ jagat sarvaṃ bhaktyā jñāyate budhaiḥ ||
translation_english: The wise realize through devotion that the entire universe rests in Viṣṇu.

transliteration: tasmād bhaktiṃ samāśritya naro bhavati mukti-bhāk ||
translation_english: Therefore, by taking refuge in devotion, a person becomes worthy of liberation.
There is no other eternal means in this world to attain Viṣṇu.
Hearing this teaching filled with devotion surely purifies a person.
Thus ends Chapter Fifteen of the Brahma Purāṇa.

sanskrit_text: ब्रह्मोवाच। शृणु धर्मस्य माहात्म्यं लोके लोकहितावहम्।
transliteration: brahmovāca | śṛṇu dharmasya māhātmyaṃ loke loka-hitāvaham ||
translation_english: Brahmā said: Hear the greatness of dharma, which brings welfare to the world.

sanskrit_text: धर्मेण धार्यते विश्वं धर्मः सर्वस्य कारणम्।
transliteration: dharmeṇa dhāryate viśvaṃ dharmaḥ sarvasya kāraṇam ||
translation_english: By dharma the universe is sustained; dharma is the cause of everything.

transliteration: dharma-hīno naro loke jīvann api mṛtopamaḥ ||
translation_english: A man devoid of dharma is like a dead person even while alive.

sanskrit_text: दानं तपः सत्यवाक्यं शौचं दयैव च।
transliteration: dānaṃ tapaḥ satya-vākyaṃ śaucaṃ dayaiva ca ||
translation_english: Charity, austerity, truthfulness, purity, and compassion—
These are the roots of dharma present in all social classes.
Charity should be given according to one’s capacity, with sincere faith.
Food-giving is great charity; the gift of knowledge is even greater.
One who grants fearlessness is always considered beloved by all.

transliteration: na hiṃsyāt sarva-bhūtāni manasā karmaṇā girā ||
translation_english: One should harm no being—by thought, action, or speech.
Non-violence is proclaimed as the highest dharma among all.
Through service to teachers and sages, dharma flourishes properly.
Reverence for mother, father, and teacher is the first step of dharma.

transliteration: kṛtajño dharma-śīlaś ca sarvatra sukham aśnute ||
translation_english: One who is grateful and righteous enjoys happiness everywhere.

sanskrit_text: धर्मो रक्षति रक्षितः सदा नात्र विचारणा।
transliteration: dharmo rakṣati rakṣitaḥ sadā nātra vicāraṇā ||
translation_english: Dharma protects those who protect it—there is no doubt in this.

transliteration: dharmāt arthaś ca kāmaś ca mokṣaś caiva prajāyate ||
translation_english: From dharma arise prosperity, pleasure, and liberation.

transliteration: dharma-mūlaṃ jagat sarvaṃ dharmaḥ śreṣṭhatamaḥ smṛtaḥ ||
translation_english: The entire world is rooted in dharma; dharma is held to be supreme.

sanskrit_text: न धर्मात्परमं किञ्चित् त्रिषु लोकेषु विद्यते।
transliteration: na dharmāt paramam kiñcit triṣu lokeṣu vidyate ||
translation_english: Nothing greater than dharma exists in the three worlds.

sanskrit_text: धर्मे स्थितो नरो नित्यं कीर्तिं पुण्यं च विन्दति।
transliteration: dharme sthito naro nityaṃ kīrtiṃ puṇyaṃ ca vindati ||
translation_english: A person established in dharma gains lasting merit and fame.
With a mind aligned to dharma, one attains the abode of Viṣṇu.

sanskrit_text: एतदुक्तं मया विप्राः धर्मस्य परमं फलम्।
transliteration: etad uktaṃ mayā viprāḥ dharmasya paramaṃ phalam ||
translation_english: Thus, O sages, I have declared the supreme fruit of dharma.

transliteration: dharmeṇa hīnaḥ puruṣo duḥkham eva samaśnute ||
translation_english: A person devoid of dharma experiences nothing but suffering.
One firmly established in dharma is freed from all sorrow.

sanskrit_text: सत्येन धार्यते लोकः सत्यं धर्मस्य लक्षणम्।
transliteration: satyena dhāryate lokaḥ satyaṃ dharmasya lakṣaṇam ||
translation_english: The world is upheld by truth; truth is the mark of dharma.
Through falsehood, all artificial forms of righteousness perish.

sanskrit_text: दया धर्मस्य सारोऽयं दयाहीनो न धर्मवित्।
transliteration: dayā dharmasya sāro’yaṃ dayā-hīno na dharmavit ||
translation_english: Compassion is the essence of dharma; one without compassion knows no dharma.

sanskrit_text: क्षमया भूषणं धर्मः क्षमाहीनो न शोभते।
transliteration: kṣamayā bhūṣaṇaṃ dharmaḥ kṣamā-hīno na śobhate ||
translation_english: Forgiveness adorns dharma; without it, dharma does not shine.

sanskrit_text: तपसा शुद्ध्यते जीवः कर्मणा बध्यते पुनः।
transliteration: tapasā śuddhyate jīvaḥ karmaṇā badhyate punaḥ ||
translation_english: Through austerity the soul is purified; through action it becomes bound again.
Right conduct is the highest dharma and beneficial to all.
A person devoid of righteous conduct is said to go to hell.

sanskrit_text: सेवया ब्राह्मणानां तु पुण्यं वर्धते नृणाम्।
transliteration: sevayā brāhmaṇānāṃ tu puṇyaṃ vardhate nṛṇām ||
translation_english: By serving the learned, a person’s merit increases.
Through honoring guests, a householder partakes in dharma.
By serving the teacher, both knowledge and dharma increase.
For one devoted to daily study, sin is always destroyed.
Sacrifice, charity, austerity, and action are manifestations of dharma.
Actions devoid of dharma indeed become fruitless.
O best of sages, the essence of dharma has been briefly explained to you.

transliteration: etad ācarato nityaṃ naraḥ śreyaḥ samaśnute ||
translation_english: One who practices this daily attains supreme welfare.

sanskrit_text: धर्ममार्गे स्थितो नित्यं विष्णुलोकं स गच्छति।
transliteration: dharma-mārge sthito nityaṃ viṣṇu-lokaṃ sa gacchati ||
translation_english: Ever established on the path of dharma, one goes to the world of Viṣṇu.
This secret of dharma should be carefully preserved.
It should be imparted especially to one devoted and faithful to dharma.

sanskrit_text: ब्राह्मणा ऊचुः। भगवन् कालतत्त्वं नः सम्यगाख्यातुमर्हसि।
transliteration: brāhmaṇā ūcuḥ | bhagavan kāla-tattvaṃ naḥ samyag ākhyātum arhasi ||
translation_english: The sages said: O Lord, kindly explain to us correctly the principle of Time.

sanskrit_text: ब्रह्मोवाच। कालो हि भगवान् विष्णुः सर्वभूतनियामकः।
transliteration: brahmovāca | kālo hi bhagavān viṣṇuḥ sarva-bhūta-niyāmakaḥ ||
translation_english: Brahmā said: Time itself is the Lord Viṣṇu, the regulator of all beings.
By Time the universe is created, and by Time it is destroyed.

sanskrit_text: कालः सृजति भूतानि कालः संहरते पुनः।
transliteration: kālaḥ sṛjati bhūtāni kālaḥ saṃharate punaḥ ||
translation_english: Time creates beings, and Time withdraws them again.

sanskrit_text: काल एव हि सर्वेषां गतिर्बन्धो विमोक्षणम्।
transliteration: kāla eva hi sarveṣāṃ gatir bandho vimokṣaṇam ||
translation_english: Time alone is the movement, bondage, and liberation of all.

sanskrit_text: न कश्चित् कालमतिक्राम्य स्थातुं शक्तो हि देहभृत्।
transliteration: na kaścit kālam atikrāmya sthātuṃ śakto hi deha-bhṛt ||
translation_english: No embodied being can stand beyond or escape Time.

transliteration: kālādhīnaṃ jagat sarvaṃ sthāvaraṃ jaṅgamaṃ tathā ||
translation_english: The entire universe, both moving and unmoving, is subject to Time.

sanskrit_text: राजानो धर्मयुक्ता ये कालं ज्ञात्वा न मुह्यति।
transliteration: rājāno dharma-yuktā ye kālaṃ jñātvā na muhyati ||
translation_english: Kings devoted to dharma do not fall into delusion, knowing the nature of Time.

sanskrit_text: कालज्ञो नृपतिः प्राज्ञः प्रजाः पालयति क्षितौ।
transliteration: kāla-jño nṛpatiḥ prājñaḥ prajāḥ pālayati kṣitau ||
translation_english: A wise king who understands Time protects his subjects on earth.
Untimely rain causes famine; timely seasons bring abundance.
As the wheel of Time turns, so arise the fruits of actions.
Beings under the control of Time experience pleasure and pain.

sanskrit_text: कालो निहन्ति दर्पं च बलं चाविचारतः।
transliteration: kālo nihanti darpaṃ ca balaṃ cā-vicārataḥ ||
translation_english: Time destroys pride and power without discrimination.

sanskrit_text: कालज्ञो न भयं याति न शोकं न च विस्मयम्।
transliteration: kāla-jño na bhayaṃ yāti na śokaṃ na ca vismayam ||
translation_english: One who understands Time experiences neither fear nor sorrow nor confusion.

transliteration: kālam eva samāśritya dharma-mārge sthito bhavet ||
translation_english: By relying on Time, one should remain established on the path of dharma.
With a mind attuned to Time, devotion to Viṣṇu increases.
Actions performed with awareness of Time aid the path to liberation.

sanskrit_text: कालतत्त्वं विजानाति स संसारं न पश्यति।
transliteration: kāla-tattvaṃ vijānāti sa saṃsāraṃ na paśyati ||
translation_english: One who understands the principle of Time no longer perceives worldly bondage.

sanskrit_text: काल एव परं ब्रह्म दृश्यरूपेण संस्थितः।
transliteration: kāla eva paraṃ brahma dṛśya-rūpeṇa saṃsthitaḥ ||
translation_english: Time itself is the Supreme Brahman manifest in visible form.

sanskrit_text: एतत् कालरहस्यं हि मया प्रोक्तं द्विजोत्तमाः।
transliteration: etat kāla-rahasyaṃ hi mayā proktaṃ dvijottamāḥ ||
translation_english: Thus, O best of the twice-born, the secret of Time has been declared by me.

sanskrit_text: कालात् ऋतवः सम्भवन्ति मासा वर्षाणि च क्रमात्।
transliteration: kālāt ṛtavaḥ sambhavanti māsā varṣāṇi ca kramāt ||
translation_english: From Time arise the seasons, months, and years in proper order.

sanskrit_text: अहोरात्रे च पक्षौ च कालस्यैव विभूतयः।
transliteration: ahorātre ca pakṣau ca kālasyaiva vibhūtayaḥ ||
translation_english: Day and night, and the fortnights, are manifestations of Time alone.
The four yugas are established upon the wheel of Time.

sanskrit_text: कृतं त्रेता द्वापरं च कलिश्चैव प्रवर्तते।
transliteration: kṛtaṃ tretā dvāparaṃ ca kaliś caiva pravartate ||
translation_english: Kṛta, Tretā, Dvāpara, and Kali proceed successively.
The duties of each age arise for embodied beings according to Time.

sanskrit_text: कृते धर्मः स्थितो नित्यं पादैः सर्वैः समन्वितः।
transliteration: kṛte dharmaḥ sthito nityaṃ pādaiḥ sarvaiḥ samanvitaḥ ||
translation_english: In the Kṛta age, dharma stands firm on all four legs.
In Tretā one leg is lost; in Dvāpara dharma stands on two legs.
In Kali, dharma remains on one leg, with Time becoming dominant.

sanskrit_text: कालदोषात् प्रजाः सर्वाः प्रमादं यान्ति मोहिताḥ।
transliteration: kāla-doṣāt prajāḥ sarvāḥ pramādaṃ yānti mohitāḥ ||
translation_english: Due to the fault of Time, all beings fall into delusion and negligence.

sanskrit_text: तस्मात् कालं विजानीयाद् धर्मे बुद्धिं निवेशयेत्।
transliteration: tasmāt kālaṃ vijānīyād dharme buddhiṃ niveśayet ||
translation_english: Therefore one should understand Time and fix the intellect in dharma.
For one devoid of knowledge of Time, austerity and charity become futile.
One who knows Time performs sacrifices always at the proper moment.

sanskrit_text: कालयुक्तं तपः कृत्वा ब्रह्मलोकं स गच्छति।
transliteration: kāla-yuktaṃ tapaḥ kṛtvā brahma-lokaṃ sa gacchati ||
translation_english: Performing austerity in harmony with Time, one goes to the world of Brahmā.
For one disciplined in Time, action destroys bondage.

sanskrit_text: कालं विष्णुं समं पश्यन् न भेदं विद्यते क्वचित्।
transliteration: kālaṃ viṣṇuṃ samaṃ paśyan na bhedaṃ vidyate kvacit ||
translation_english: Seeing Time and Viṣṇu as one, no duality is perceived.
Some, devoted to meditation on Time, transcend worldly existence.

sanskrit_text: कालस्य महिमा ह्येष मया संक्षेपतः स्मृतः।
transliteration: kālasya mahimā hy eṣa mayā saṃkṣepataḥ smṛtaḥ ||
translation_english: This greatness of Time has been briefly described by me.

sanskrit_text: एतद् विज्ञाय मेधावी न शोचति न मुह्यति।
transliteration: etad vijñāya medhāvī na śocati na muhyati ||
translation_english: Knowing this, the wise neither grieve nor fall into delusion.
Taking refuge in the principle of Time, one should fix the mind on dharma.
Thus, O best of the twice-born, the discourse on Time has been declared by me.
Now the praise of charity is spoken, as an expansion of dharma.

sanskrit_text: दानं यज्ञस्तपो ज्ञानं सर्वं धर्मे प्रतिष्ठितम्।
transliteration: dānaṃ yajñas tapo jñānaṃ sarvaṃ dharme pratiṣṭhitam ||
translation_english: Charity, sacrifice, austerity, and knowledge—all are established in dharma.
Through charity dharma grows; charity destroys sin.

sanskrit_text: अन्नदानं परं दानं विद्यादानं ततः परम्।
transliteration: anna-dānaṃ paraṃ dānaṃ vidyā-dānaṃ tataḥ param ||
translation_english: Food-giving is the supreme charity; higher still is the gift of knowledge.
One should give according to one’s capacity, especially with faith.

sanskrit_text: अश्रद्धया हुतं दत्तं तपस्तप्तं च निष्फलम्।
transliteration: aśraddhayā hutaṃ dattaṃ tapas taptaṃ ca niṣphalam ||
translation_english: Offerings, gifts, and austerities done without faith are fruitless.

sanskrit_text: देशे काले च पात्रे च दानं स्याद् धर्मवर्धनम्।
transliteration: deśe kāle ca pātre ca dānaṃ syād dharma-vardhanam ||
translation_english: Charity given at the proper place, time, and to a worthy recipient increases dharma.

sanskrit_text: अपात्रे दीयमानं तु दानं न फलदायकम्।
transliteration: apātre dīyamānaṃ tu dānaṃ na phala-dāyakam ||
translation_english: Charity given to an unworthy recipient does not yield fruit.
Charity given to a Brāhmaṇa is especially remembered as granting liberation.
One should give to the virtuous, the protector of the poor, and the ascetic.

transliteration: gavāṃ bhūmer hiraṇyasya vastrāṇām annam eva ca ||
translation_english: Cows, land, gold, garments, and food—
—these forms of charity are declared to be meritorious.
The gift of water is greatly meritorious, equal to the gift of life.
Granting fearlessness to all beings is the highest charity.

sanskrit_text: दानं दत्त्वा न शोचेत न गर्वं च समाचरेत्।
transliteration: dānaṃ dattvā na śocet na garvaṃ ca samācaret ||
translation_english: Having given charity, one should neither regret nor act with pride.
Charity free from ego becomes most fruitful.
Compassionate charity toward suffering beings is especially praised.

sanskrit_text: दानं धर्मस्य मूलं हि दानात् सर्वं प्रवर्तते।
transliteration: dānaṃ dharmasya mūlaṃ hi dānāt sarvaṃ pravartate ||
translation_english: Charity is the root of dharma; from charity all virtue proceeds.
Even a poor man without wealth is not blameworthy if his conduct is virtuous.

transliteration: alpam apy athavā dānaṃ śraddhayā dattam akṣayam ||
translation_english: Even a small gift, given with faith, becomes imperishable.
Charity grants heaven to humans and serves as a means to liberation.
Charity is pure, meritorious, and beneficial in both worlds.

sanskrit_text: इह कीर्तिं परत्रापि सुखं दानात् समश्नुते।
transliteration: iha kīrtiṃ paratrāpi sukhaṃ dānāt samaśnute ||
translation_english: Through charity one gains fame here and happiness hereafter.

sanskrit_text: दानं हि परमं पुण्यं कथितं मुनिसत्तमैः।
transliteration: dānaṃ hi paramaṃ puṇyaṃ kathitaṃ muni-sattamaiḥ ||
translation_english: Charity is declared the highest merit by the greatest sages.
With a mind devoted to charity, one attains the world of Viṣṇu.

sanskrit_text: दानधर्मे रतः स नित्यं संसारात् समुच्यते।
transliteration: dāna-dharme rataḥ sa nityaṃ saṃsārāt samucyate ||
translation_english: One constantly devoted to charitable dharma is freed from worldly bondage.

sanskrit_text: दानं कृत्वा विशुद्धात्मा विष्णुं पश्यति सर्वतः।
transliteration: dānaṃ kṛtvā viśuddhātmā viṣṇuṃ paśyati sarvataḥ ||
translation_english: Having given charity, the purified soul sees Viṣṇu everywhere.

sanskrit_text: न दानेन समं पुण्यं न दानेन समं सुखम्।
transliteration: na dānena samaṃ puṇyaṃ na dānena samaṃ sukham ||
translation_english: There is no merit equal to charity, no happiness equal to charity.

transliteration: dānam eva paraṃ śreyaḥ sarva-dharmeṣu kathyate ||
translation_english: Among all dharmas, charity alone is said to be the supreme good.

sanskrit_text: एवं दानविधानं तु मया प्रोक्तं द्विजोत्तमाः।
transliteration: evaṃ dāna-vidhānaṃ tu mayā proktaṃ dvijottamāḥ ||
translation_english: Thus the rules of charity have been explained by me, O best of the twice-born.

transliteration: śrutvaitad yaḥ paṭhen nityaṃ śraddhayā niyatātmavān ||
translation_english: Whoever hears or recites this daily with faith and self-control—
—is freed from all sins and attains the world of Viṣṇu.
Life united with charity and dharma becomes truly fruitful.
This is the secret of dharma proclaimed in the Purāṇas.
Charity itself is the great sacrifice that benefits all beings.

sanskrit_text: दानयुक्तः सदा भक्त्या हरिं सम्पूजयेत् नरः।
transliteration: dāna-yuktaḥ sadā bhaktyā hariṃ sampūjayet naraḥ ||
translation_english: A man devoted to charity worships Hari with true devotion.

sanskrit_text: दानं त्यागश्च शौचं च त्रयो धर्मस्य लक्षणम्।
transliteration: dānaṃ tyāgaś ca śaucaṃ ca trayo dharmasya lakṣaṇam ||
translation_english: Charity, renunciation, and purity are the three marks of dharma.

sanskrit_text: एतानि यस्य विद्यन्ते स जीवन्नेव मुक्तिभाक्।
transliteration: etāni yasya vidyante sa jīvan-neva mukti-bhāk ||
translation_english: He who possesses these attains liberation even while living.
Hearing this exposition on charity and dharma frees one from bondage.
Thus ends the praise of charity as proclaimed in the Brahma Purāṇa.
Now the discipline of devotion is explained, united with righteousness.

sanskrit_text: भक्त्या तुष्यति गोविन्दो न तपो न च विद्यया।
transliteration: bhaktyā tuṣyati govindo na tapo na ca vidyayā ||
translation_english: Govinda is pleased by devotion alone, not by austerity nor learning.

sanskrit_text: न दानेन न यज्ञेन केवलं भक्तिरुच्यते।
transliteration: na dānena na yajñena kevalaṃ bhaktir ucyate ||
translation_english: Neither by charity nor sacrifice alone, but by devotion is He attained.

sanskrit_text: यथा दीपः प्रकाशेन तमो नाशयति क्षणात्।
transliteration: yathā dīpaḥ prakāśena tamo nāśayati kṣaṇāt ||
translation_english: Just as a lamp instantly destroys darkness with light,

sanskrit_text: तथा भक्तिः प्रसन्नात्मा पापं नाशयति ध्रुवम्।
transliteration: tathā bhaktiḥ prasannātmā pāpaṃ nāśayati dhruvam ||
translation_english: So devotion, when the heart is pure, surely destroys sin.
Hearing, chanting of Viṣṇu, remembrance, and service at His feet—
Worship, reverence, servitude, friendship, and self-surrender—

transliteration: navadhā bhaktir ity uktā viṣṇu-bhaktaiḥ sanātanaiḥ ||
translation_english: These nine forms of devotion are taught by the eternal devotees of Viṣṇu.

transliteration: etābhir anvito bhakto viṣṇu-lokaṃ sa gacchati ||
translation_english: Endowed with these, the devotee attains the realm of Viṣṇu.

sanskrit_text: न जातिर्न कुलं तत्र न विद्यापि विशिष्यते।
transliteration: na jātir na kulaṃ tatra na vidyāpi viśiṣyate ||
translation_english: Neither birth, lineage, nor learning is considered superior there.

sanskrit_text: भक्तिर्यत्र स्थिता नित्यं स एव पुरुषोत्तमः।
transliteration: bhaktir yatra sthitā nityaṃ sa eva puruṣottamaḥ ||
translation_english: Where devotion abides eternally, that one is truly exalted.

sanskrit_text: भक्तिहीनस्य न ज्ञानं न मोक्षो न च सद्गतिः।
transliteration: bhakti-hīnasya na jñānaṃ na mokṣo na ca sad-gatiḥ ||
translation_english: Without devotion, there is no true knowledge, liberation, or noble destiny.

sanskrit_text: भक्त्या हि पुरुषो विष्णुं पश्यत्यात्मनि सर्वदा।
transliteration: bhaktyā hi puruṣo viṣṇuṃ paśyaty ātmani sarvadā ||
translation_english: Through devotion, a person always perceives Viṣṇu within the self.
He sees the self in all beings and all beings within the self.
Thus endowed with devotion, one is called liberated while living.

transliteration: bhaktir hi paramaṃ sādhanaṃ saṃsāra-taraṇe nṛṇām ||
translation_english: Devotion is the supreme means for humans to cross worldly existence.
Nothing equal to devotion is seen in the three worlds.

transliteration: bhakti-yukto hi puruṣo viṣṇor aikyaṃ prapadyate ||
translation_english: The person endowed with devotion attains unity with Viṣṇu.

sanskrit_text: इदं रहस्यं भक्तीनां मया प्रोक्तं द्विजोत्तमाः।
transliteration: idaṃ rahasyaṃ bhaktīnāṃ mayā proktaṃ dvijottamāḥ ||
translation_english: This secret of devotion has been declared by me, O best of the twice-born.
Hearing this teaching of devotion, a person crosses the ocean of existence.

sanskrit_text: भक्त्या लभ्यः परो विष्णुर्न तर्केण न विद्यया।
transliteration: bhaktyā labhyaḥ paro viṣṇur na tarkeṇa na vidyayā ||
translation_english: The supreme Viṣṇu is attained through devotion, not by logic nor mere learning.

sanskrit_text: यस्य चित्तं हरेर्नित्यं तस्य दुःखं न विद्यते।
transliteration: yasya cittaṃ harer nityaṃ tasya duḥkhaṃ na vidyate ||
translation_english: For one whose mind constantly rests in Hari, sorrow does not exist.

transliteration: bhaktasya sarvadā śāntir bhavati nātra saṃśayaḥ ||
translation_english: Peace always belongs to the devotee; of this there is no doubt.
Renouncing all actions to Viṣṇu, the devotee becomes liberated.

transliteration: bhakti-rūpaṃ mahā-jñānaṃ bhaktir eva parā gatiḥ ||
translation_english: Devotion itself is supreme knowledge, devotion alone is the highest goal.

sanskrit_text: भक्तेः परं न पश्यामि साधनं मोक्षसाधकम्।
transliteration: bhakteḥ paraṃ na paśyāmi sādhanaṃ mokṣa-sādhakam ||
translation_english: I see no means higher than devotion for attaining liberation.

transliteration: na bhakti-hīnaḥ puruṣaḥ kadācit sukham edhate ||
translation_english: A person devoid of devotion never truly prospers in happiness.
Endowed with devotion, one remains pure and lives in the spirit of Viṣṇu.

sanskrit_text: सर्वेषु भूतेषु हरिं पश्यन् भक्तो न लिप्यते।
transliteration: sarveṣu bhūteṣu hariṃ paśyan bhakto na lipyate ||
translation_english: Seeing Hari in all beings, the devotee is never bound.

transliteration: bhakti-sāgaram āsādya na punar jāyate naraḥ ||
translation_english: Reaching the ocean of devotion, a person is not born again.

sanskrit_text: भक्तेः प्रसादात् पुरुषो विष्णुलोकं स गच्छति।
transliteration: bhakteḥ prasādāt puruṣo viṣṇu-lokaṃ sa gacchati ||
translation_english: By the grace of devotion, one attains the realm of Viṣṇu.

sanskrit_text: नरकं न भयं तस्य न मृत्युः संप्रजायते।
transliteration: narakaṃ na bhayaṃ tasya na mṛtyuḥ saṃprajāyate ||
translation_english: For such a one, there is no fear of hell and no fear of death.
By devotion to Viṣṇu, one is freed from all sins.
Through the yoga of devotion, perfection is attained without doubt.

sanskrit_text: इदं धर्मं परं गुह्यं भक्तिमूलं सनातनम्।
transliteration: idaṃ dharmaṃ paraṃ guhyaṃ bhakti-mūlaṃ sanātanam ||
translation_english: This supreme and secret dharma has devotion as its eternal root.

sanskrit_text: एतद् विज्ञाय मेधावी विष्णुभक्तो भवेद् ध्रुवम्।
transliteration: etad vijñāya medhāvī viṣṇu-bhakto bhaved dhruvam ||
translation_english: Knowing this, the wise surely become devotees of Viṣṇu.

sanskrit_text: भक्तेः फलमिदं प्रोक्तं यथाशास्त्रं मया द्विजाः।
transliteration: bhakteḥ phalam idaṃ proktaṃ yathā-śāstraṃ mayā dvijāḥ ||
