translation_english: Thus the fruits of devotion have been taught according to scripture.

sanskrit_text: श्रद्धया योऽनुशृणुयात् स याति परमां गतिम्।
transliteration: śraddhayā yo’nuśṛṇuyāt sa yāti paramāṃ gatim ||
translation_english: One who listens with faith attains the supreme destination.
This devotion-centered knowledge destroys all worldly bondage.
Thus ends this eternal discourse on devotion as spoken by me.
Now the ordinances of dharma, connected with the varṇas and āśramas, are described.
Of the Brāhmaṇa, Kṣatriya, Vaiśya, and Śūdra—
I shall explain their respective duties according to the scriptures.
Teaching, austerity, and purity are especially the duties of a Brāhmaṇa.

sanskrit_text: दानं प्रतिग्रहं चैव यजनं याजनं तथा।
transliteration: dānaṃ pratigrahaṃ caiva yajjanaṃ yājanaṃ tathā ||
translation_english: Charity, acceptance of gifts, sacrifice, and officiating sacrifices—
These are declared the duties of the Brāhmaṇa, O best of the twice-born.

sanskrit_text: रक्षणं प्रजयानां च दानं यज्ञश्च क्षत्रियः।
transliteration: rakṣaṇaṃ prajayānāṃ ca dānaṃ yajñaś ca kṣatriyaḥ ||
translation_english: Protection of subjects, charity, and sacrifice are the duties of a Kṣatriya.

transliteration: śauryaṃ tejo dhṛtir dākṣyaṃ yuddhe cāpy apalāyanam ||
translation_english: Valor, strength, patience, skill, and never fleeing from battle—
These are declared the righteous duties of a Kṣatriya.
Agriculture, cattle-rearing, and trade are the natural duties of a Vaiśya.

sanskrit_text: दानं धर्मे च निष्ठा च वैश्यस्यापि विधीयते।
transliteration: dānaṃ dharme ca niṣṭhā ca vaiśyasyāpi vidhīyate ||
translation_english: Charity and steadfastness in dharma are also enjoined upon the Vaiśya.
Service to the twice-born is the supreme duty of the Śūdra.

sanskrit_text: सत्यं शौचं दया क्षान्तिः सर्वेषां धर्मसाधनम्।
transliteration: satyaṃ śaucaṃ dayā kṣāntiḥ sarveṣāṃ dharma-sādhanam ||
translation_english: Truthfulness, purity, compassion, and patience are duties common to all.
A person devoted to their own duty always attains perfection.
Another’s duty is dangerous; even death in one’s own duty is better.

sanskrit_text: एवं धर्मविधिं ज्ञात्वा नरः पापैः प्रमुच्यते।
transliteration: evaṃ dharma-vidhiṃ jñātvā naraḥ pāpaiḥ pramucyate ||
translation_english: Knowing these rules of dharma, a person is freed from sin.

sanskrit_text: धर्मे स्थितस्य पुरुषस्य विष्णुः प्रीयते ध्रुवम्।
transliteration: dharme sthitasya puruṣasya viṣṇuḥ prīyate dhruvam ||
translation_english: Viṣṇu is surely pleased with one who stands firm in dharma.

sanskrit_text: धर्मो विष्णुः स्वयं प्रोक्तः शास्त्रज्ञैः सनातनः।
transliteration: dharmo viṣṇuḥ svayaṃ proktaḥ śāstra-jñaiḥ sanātanaḥ ||
translation_english: Dharma itself is declared to be Viṣṇu by the knowers of scripture.

sanskrit_text: तस्माद् धर्मं समाश्रित्य विष्णुभक्तो भवेद् नरः।
transliteration: tasmād dharmaṃ samāśritya viṣṇu-bhakto bhaved naraḥ ||
translation_english: Therefore, taking refuge in dharma, one becomes a devotee of Viṣṇu.
Thus this explanation of dharma has been given by me in proper order.
This dharma is especially proclaimed for the householder.

transliteration: yataḥ sarvāśramāṇāṃ ca gṛhastho mūlam ucyate ||
translation_english: For the householder is said to be the foundation of all āśramas.

sanskrit_text: अतिथीनां च पूजायां देवतानां च तर्पणे।
transliteration: atithīnāṃ ca pūjāyāṃ devatānāṃ ca tarpaṇe ||
translation_english: In honoring guests and satisfying the gods—

sanskrit_text: पितॄणां तर्पणे चैव गृहस्थस्य फलं महत्।
transliteration: pitṝṇāṃ tarpaṇe caiva gṛhasthasya phalaṃ mahat ||
translation_english: And in offerings to the ancestors, the householder gains great merit.
One established in brahmacarya, devoted to Vedic study—
By constant service to the teacher, proceeds on the path of dharma.

transliteration: vānaprastho vanaṃ gatvā tapasā śuddhim āpnuyāt ||
translation_english: The forest-dweller, going to the woods, attains purification through austerity.
Living on roots and fruits, peaceful, having conquered senses and desires.
The renunciate, abandoning all actions, becomes liberated.
By freedom from the sense of ‘mine,’ a person becomes free.
Non-violence, truth, non-stealing, continence, compassion, and straightforwardness—
These are declared by the great sages as the roots of universal dharma.
The yogin endowed with knowledge always attains the abode of Viṣṇu.

sanskrit_text: न कर्मणा न जन्मेन मोक्षः स्यात् पुरुषोत्तम।
transliteration: na karmaṇā na janmena mokṣaḥ syāt puruṣottama ||
translation_english: Liberation is attained neither by action nor by birth alone, O best of beings.
Through knowledge combined with devotion, one is liberated—no doubt of this.

sanskrit_text: विष्णुभक्त्या परं स्थानं प्राप्नोति पुरुषः सदा।
transliteration: viṣṇu-bhaktyā paraṃ sthānaṃ prāpnoti puruṣaḥ sadā ||
translation_english: By devotion to Viṣṇu, a person always attains the supreme state.
But one devoid of dharma and knowledge is consumed by sin.

sanskrit_text: तस्माद् धर्मं च विज्ञानं भजेद् भक्त्या समन्वितम्।
transliteration: tasmād dharmaṃ ca vijñānaṃ bhajed bhaktyā samanvitam ||
translation_english: Therefore, one should cultivate dharma and wisdom together with devotion.
This is the path of dharma in the world, the destroyer of all sins.

transliteration: iti dharma-vidhiṃ śrutvā naraḥ siddhim avāpnuyāt ||
translation_english: Thus, having heard this doctrine of dharma, a person attains perfection.
Then the creation of the universe was manifested by the grace of Brahmā.
All the deities appeared, being the cause of the Manvantara.
The course of actions in creation is shown in the dharma scriptures.
The progeny of Manu were created as caretakers of the worlds.

sanskrit_text: सत्यं धर्मं च यजनं देवताभ्यः समर्पितम्।
transliteration: satyaṃ dharmaṃ ca yajñaṃ devatābhyaḥ samarpiṭam ||
translation_english: Truth, dharma, and sacrifice were offered to the deities.

transliteration: asurebhyaḥ pāpa-saṃyuktaṃ karma na kartavyam iti ||
translation_english: One should not perform actions united with sin or for the demons.

sanskrit_text: सर्वे भवन्तु सुखिनः सर्वे सन्तु निरामयाः।
transliteration: sarve bhavantu sukhinaḥ sarve santu nirāmayāḥ ||
translation_english: May all beings be happy; may all be free from illness.

sanskrit_text: दानं धर्मेण सह कर्तव्यम् साधूनामेव च।
transliteration: dānaṃ dharmeṇa saha kartavyam sādhūnāmeva ca ||
translation_english: Charity, along with dharma, should be performed, especially for the virtuous.

sanskrit_text: सत्येन नित्यं युक्तः प्राप्नोति परमं पदम्।
transliteration: satyena nityaṃ yuktaḥ prāpnoti paramaṃ padam ||
translation_english: One constantly devoted to truth attains the supreme abode.

sanskrit_text: अहिंसा धृतिः क्षान्तिः ब्रह्मचर्यं तपः शौचम्।
transliteration: ahiṃsā dhṛtiḥ kṣāntiḥ brahmacaryaṃ tapaḥ śaucam ||
translation_english: Non-violence, steadiness, patience, celibacy, austerity, and purity—
These virtuous observances are constantly practiced by men devoted to dharma.
The seven sages appeared, steadfast in truth.

sanskrit_text: सृष्टेः प्रारम्भे देवता लोकान् रक्षन्ति नित्यम्।
transliteration: sṛṣṭeḥ prārambhe devatā lokān rakṣanti nityam ||
translation_english: At the beginning of creation, the deities constantly protect the worlds.

sanskrit_text: यथा धर्मः तथा मोक्षः प्राप्तव्यम् पुरुषैः।
transliteration: yathā dharmaḥ tathā mokṣaḥ prāptavyam puruṣaiḥ ||
translation_english: According to dharma, liberation is attained by humans.
Endowed with truth and knowledge, one always reaches the presence of Brahmā.
Virtuous conduct should always be performed by a person, according to dharma.
Through meditation and yoga, the practitioner remains firm on the path of liberation.
Renunciation of the fruits of all actions grants a person liberation.
One united with devotion to Viṣṇu always stands on the path of liberation.
Thus ends the twenty-first chapter of the Brahma Purāṇa.
The king’s observance of dharma is the cause of the welfare of the people.

sanskrit_text: सत्येन शासनं कुर्यात् न्यायेन च प्रचालयेत्।
transliteration: satyena śāsanaṃ kuryāt nyāyena ca pracālayet ||
translation_english: The king should govern with truth and administer justice.

sanskrit_text: सर्वे प्रजा संतुष्टाः राज्ञः राज्यं समाचरन्ति।
transliteration: sarve prajā santuṣṭāḥ rājñaḥ rājyaṃ samācaranti ||
translation_english: When all subjects are content, the king administers the kingdom properly.
Charity, combined with dharma, should always be performed for the virtuous.
A person devoted to truth remains firm in governance.
Through meditation and yoga, the practitioner always stands firm on the path of liberation.
Renunciation of the fruits of all actions grants a person liberation.
One united with devotion to Viṣṇu always stands on the path of liberation.
Endowed with truth and knowledge, one always reaches the presence of Brahmā.
Virtuous conduct should always be performed by a person, according to dharma.
Worship of all deities is to be performed, by the grace of the Lord of Creatures.

sanskrit_text: प्रजासुखाय सततं राज्ञः धर्मं पालनं कर्तव्यम्।
transliteration: prajā-sukhāya satataṃ rājñaḥ dharmaṃ pālanaṃ kartavyam ||
translation_english: For the welfare of the people, the king must constantly observe dharma.
The people united with dharma prosper under a king devoted to truth.
In all undertakings, dharma should be observed according to the scriptures.
Virtuous conduct is foremost and yields results when combined with dharma.

sanskrit_text: प्रजा सन्तुष्टाः भूत्वा राज्ञः राज्यं समाचरन्ति।
transliteration: prajā santuṣṭāḥ bhūtvā rājñaḥ rājyaṃ samācaranti ||
translation_english: When the subjects are content, the king administers the kingdom properly.
The king’s adherence to dharma grants success in all endeavors.

sanskrit_text: सर्वे प्रजा संतुष्टाः भूत्वा राज्यं नयनं सुखम्।
transliteration: sarve prajā santuṣṭāḥ bhūtvā rājyaṃ nayanaṃ sukham ||
translation_english: When all the people are pleased, the kingdom becomes a source of joy.
Endowed with truth and knowledge, one always reaches the presence of Brahmā.
Thus ends the twenty-first chapter of the Brahma Purāṇa.
Thus begins the twenty-second chapter, by the grace of Brahmā.
The dharma of kings is expounded for the protection of the world.

sanskrit_text: सत्कार्याणि च दानानि लोकहिताय च कर्तव्यानि।
transliteration: satkāryāṇi ca dānāni loka-hitāya ca kartavyāni ||
translation_english: Proper deeds and charity should be performed for the welfare of the world.

sanskrit_text: सत्येन शासनं कुर्यात् न्यायेन च प्रवर्तते।
transliteration: satyena śāsanaṃ kuryāt nyāyena ca pravartate ||
translation_english: One should govern with truth and act in accordance with justice.
The king should promote dharma in all undertakings.
The welfare of the people must be the king’s firm duty.

sanskrit_text: सर्वे राजा धर्मज्ञा भूत्वा राज्यं संपादयेत्।
transliteration: sarve rājā dharma-jñā bhūtvā rājyaṃ sampādayet ||
translation_english: All kings, being learned in dharma, should administer their kingdom accordingly.
The earth is secured when governed according to dharma.
Charity should always be performed in accordance with dharma for the virtuous.
Always uphold truth in speech for the happiness of the people.
Justice must be the primary duty of a king for the protection of his subjects.
When all act according to dharma, the people are happy.
The people united with dharma prosper under a king devoted to truth.
In all undertakings, dharma should be observed according to the scriptures.
Virtuous conduct is foremost and yields results when combined with dharma.

sanskrit_text: प्रजा सन्तुष्टाः भूत्वा राज्ञः राज्यं समाचरन्ति।
transliteration: prajā santuṣṭāḥ bhūtvā rājñaḥ rājyaṃ samācaranti ||
translation_english: When the subjects are content, the king administers the kingdom properly.
The king’s adherence to dharma grants success in all endeavors.
Worship of all deities is to be performed, by the grace of the Lord of Creatures.

sanskrit_text: प्रजासुखाय सततं राज्ञः धर्मं पालनं कर्तव्यम्।
transliteration: prajā-sukhāya satataṃ rājñaḥ dharmaṃ pālanaṃ kartavyam ||
translation_english: For the welfare of the people, the king must constantly observe dharma.
Thus ends the twenty-second chapter of the Brahma Purāṇa.

transliteration: dharmeṇa rājyaṃ kurvāṇo rājā svargam avāpnuyāt ||
translation_english: A king who rules according to dharma attains heaven.
A kingdom established through unrighteousness perishes quickly.

sanskrit_text: प्रजाहितं सदा कृत्वा राजा कीर्तिं समश्नुते।
transliteration: prajā-hitaṃ sadā kṛtvā rājā kīrtiṃ samaśnute ||
translation_english: By always acting for the welfare of the people, a king gains lasting fame.
One devoted to charity, sacrifice, and austerity is freed from all sins.

sanskrit_text: न्यायेन रक्षिताः प्रजा वर्धन्ते नात्र संशयः।
transliteration: nyāyena rakṣitāḥ prajā vardhante nātra saṃśayaḥ ||
translation_english: People protected through justice prosper—there is no doubt about it.
A king devoted to truth and dharma governs the worlds steadily.

sanskrit_text: अहिंसया प्रजाः सर्वाः सुखिनो भवन्ति हि।
transliteration: ahiṃsayā prajāḥ sarvāḥ sukhino bhavanti hi ||
translation_english: Through non-violence, all subjects indeed become happy.

sanskrit_text: राज्ञः पापे प्रजा दुःखं भजन्ति न संशयः।
transliteration: rājñaḥ pāpe prajā duḥkhaṃ bhajanti na saṃśayaḥ ||
translation_english: When the king sins, the people suffer—without doubt.
A righteous king becomes godlike in this world.

sanskrit_text: शास्त्रदृष्ट्या कृतं कर्म सफलं भवति ध्रुवम्।
transliteration: śāstra-dṛṣṭyā kṛtaṃ karma saphalaṃ bhavati dhruvam ||
translation_english: Actions performed according to scripture surely bear fruit.
A king should follow the dharma scriptures to attain liberation.
All forms of dharma arise from the presence of Viṣṇu.
A king devoted to Viṣṇu becomes firmly established in the world.
Dharma alone is the supreme principle for governing the people.

sanskrit_text: धर्मेण वर्धते राज्यं धर्मेण क्षीयतेऽपि च।
transliteration: dharmeṇa vardhate rājyaṃ dharmeṇa kṣīyate’pi ca ||
translation_english: By dharma a kingdom grows, and by abandoning dharma it declines.

transliteration: prajāsu dharmaṃ sthāpya rājā sukham avāpnuyāt ||
translation_english: Establishing dharma among the people, the king attains happiness.
Having worked for the welfare of all worlds, a king attains Brahmaloka.

sanskrit_text: धर्मयुक्तं कृतं कर्म न कदाचिद् विनश्यति।
transliteration: dharma-yuktaṃ kṛtaṃ karma na kadācid vinaśyati ||
translation_english: Actions performed with dharma never perish.
Thus the dharma of kings, which sustains the world, was taught by Brahmā.
Thus ends the twenty-second chapter.
